Now I'm not art buff but the paintings and poems are interesting, as is the people that Don Antonio interacted with.The gardens are small but well maintained and there are bird cages dotted all around. As you enter the garden you will find a few parrots and a hornbill sat waiting for photos. A quick stroke and a nudge and the hornbill will step right up, and just like the rest of Bali at no extra charge.The money to time ratio is good as we were there about 1 1/2 hours at IDR 150,000 for the both of us.

Interesting!. Went here solo before my husband joined me in Ubud. What an interesting museum. I appreciated the historical context that it provided and enjoyed wandering around the grounds and building. The art was also delightful and somewhat eclectic - especially toward the latter part of Blanco's life! Worth a visit if you have ample time and enjoy fine art.

The eccentric Blaco .. Well worth a visit to view Antonio's work , which could be classed as somewhat dated and out of fashion now however are most enjoyable . Tucked away in a corner you may find inscriptions on the Wall of Greta Garbo and other famous people who visited in the Seventies . There are some beautiful Birds in the Garden plus a pleasant Restaurant .
Amazing. This place is family friendly and a good place to visit if you appreciate art and want something different to do for the day. Completely ostentatious and fun!

"Bali-breast". "Bali-breast" was the article that I read inside the Blanco Museum. The entrance ticket IDR 30,000 and you can get a free welcome drink at their cafe. From the entrance door, we go through and will seeing varies of beautiful birds. Some of the birds were so friendly, we can take a photo together with them.Then, move to the inside, in the building we were prohibited to bring camera and drink. That's what the signs told us. So I just bring my phone and took several pictures silently. Most of the paintings were pictured naked women. I read the description under the photos, Antonio Blanco's models were vary and international. He also painted Michael Jackson. Then I read the "Bali-breast" article. It said that during the past, women in some area in Bali were half naked doing their activities. And it was because of a tradition that formed their breast muscle into a great shape, when the ceremony held, they always bring the things to offering to god, and they put on top of their head. The exercise that they've been done formed their muscle around shoulders and chest. Now that makes me thinking to start doing that exercise, ha!
Interesting museum!. Not far from Ubud town centre. In our view well worth visiting - it is an interesting museum/art collection (some for over 18s only) in a very nice building.

The Blanco museum in Ubud in a nice well maintained garden setting. Don Antonio Blanco's museum of art and gallery is located in a nice and well maintained garden setting in Ubud, Bali. The garden has a lot of Balinese fruit trees, flowers and birds. There is also a restaurant where you can enjoy a meal overlooking the nice garden. Wayan who works at the museum explained to us the history of the gallery and museum in an interesting way.

Our starter daytrip.... Great atmosphere once we enter the museum. Look surrounding and great location. Amazing staff greet us and also great explanation by Mbok Agustín help us to know more but this museum.As I am blind about the art but a Lil bit knew the artis expression to their canvas.Must visit before noon....

Beautiful grounds but I'm not much of a Blanco fan.. Not really very interesting or engaging. I guess Blanco was well known but I hadn't heard of him before and the museum didn't make me a fan. It was probably the low point of our Bali sightseeing

This is a mandatory place to visit for travelers to Ubud.. Antonia Blanco is the Dali of Bali, a painter of tremendous talent and nerve. His home, which is now the museum, is fabulous, and home to a collection of exotic birds. Unfortunately the religious crazies have insisted on "blurring" some of the arts racier parts. This happened recently, and we were shocked to see it. Big mistake. But go anyway.

Pretty awful collection of cheesy paintings. This is a homage to a Spanish American artist who admired the sensuality of Balinese women. OK, but it is pretty sexist and patronising, treating Balinese people as objects for white Westeners. Very creepy.A bit like Paul Gaugin in Tahiti, but one hundred times less good, in artistic terms.All in all, a ghastly show of sexism and racialism. and poor art.
Nice Museum. I liked it but I preferred the Puri Luki Museum, the architecture at the Blanco museum was stunning however.
Beautiful Blanco. I love the Blanco Museum, I've been there twice now. There are beautiful birds to look at, beautiful art and gorgeous gardens and scenery. A must not miss if in Ubud.
Interesting character alert...... Loved the whole thing, great place to have a look around and get a sense of an expatriate artists life in Ubud, great art, interesting stories.....
Antonio Blanco amazing Museum . Amazing place .. I had a lot fun with guide who showed me around! Great personal. Привет с Кавказа Карачаево Черкессия !!

Both great and weird experience. Great work of "Indonesian Dali", mainly erotic paintings. Based in former Blanco's house that is both weird and entertaining. No photo's allowed but also no photo's, cataloque of book of artist available at the shop there.

A particular artist displays his life's work. Antonio Blanco has lived most of his life in Bali and inspired by modern avantgarde painters has developed his own style, inspired and taken further by Balinese colors and tropical influences. In his particular style the whole museum is a hommage to his life's work, and his particular style and taste. A must for any artist or art-lover once you are in ubud.
Don't miss this if you are an artlover. Loved the artwork and the birds on arrival. The art inside the magnificent home is something out of the box.

Nice grounds. Not a ton of artwork to see. The grounds were pretty. Best part was holding the birds when you first walk in and the man taking our picture. The complimentary drink in the restaurant was good and they had a nice view!

POISONING drink at Stylish Museum. DO NOT DRINK the complementary beverage. My partner and me went there in the morning, had that DRINK, came straight back to the hotel feeling headache (without eating any lunch) Then we both started to vomit 4-5times each, followed by diarrhoea, fever, pain all over the body... Symptoms lasted over 36hrs.It's only small( like a short). We were told there is vanilla essence and citrus juice in it. But it taste like cheap perfume. I suspect they have used essential oils (not for human consumption)in it. I only had a small taste. My partner finished it. And he had more nasty symptoms afterwards.DO NOT DRINK IT. We learned it the hard way. Maybe it's not poisoning everyday. But, do you want to try your luck??? Don't forget Advanced Medical Service is NOT AVAILABLE here.-----------------------------------------------------The museum itself was quite unique. You can go to the roof and have a better view of surrounding area. (You are allowed to photos once u are on the roof)------------------------------------------------------BirdsI scared of animals. Having chicken walking all over the place was very stressful for me. The three big birds standing on the tree at garden entrance are really beautiful. But they barely moved for a long time. I asked the staff, they cannot answer why.( must be a story behind them) I don't mind IF "they are rescued from somewhere, cannot fly any more..." But I don't think that's the case. They would have made an introduction about it if that's the story.I don't think they are pinned on the tree. Because I saw one jumped (not fly) off the tree step by step when I left.

Artistic and amazing place !. he is not Indonesian, but we saw he loves Indonesian soooo much. We can see all from all the art there. We already fall in love with this country too ! Just do not bring your kids here, not suitable.So artistic, so amazing. That is my two words for this museum.

Very peculiar . The museum itself it's not that big but it's a unique place that is worth a visit. The ticket is 80.000 with a complementary drink (a very small one, especially if compared to the one included in the ticket to visit the ARMA museum).

Take pictures with tropical birds for free before entering the museum. Paintings are good, but the view outside of the buildings is even better. Plus, you get to take pictures with the exotic tropical birds before entering the museum, for free!PS. You could climb the stair on the terrace of the building to get to the rooftop and get a view from up there. You could see the Campuhan Hill too
What a find. The birds were spectacular & a great photo opportunity. Fabulous museum & wonderful explanations by the local guide. Not suitable for children. Really worth a visit.
Terrific Artworks. such a good place to relax while enjoyinh his majestic Artworks, and credit plus for Bli Wayan who explained about Blanco Artwotks there.

Kinda crazy kinda fun. Visited this after reading reviews and having some time to kill. Beautiful albeit eccentric art. Well worth the time to visit if you have around an hour. Got a free drink with the ticket as well which was pretty tasty

Eccentric place in Ubud. Visited here and enjoyed it looking round the place and the many photogenic things outside in the garden and on the roof area. Staff very nice here and has good restaurant and cafe in the grounds .The Art by Blanco is good a bit like Salvador Dali who was better known ,but eccentric And painted beautifully some portraits are excellent.The music they play inside was a poor mans three Tenor's and did not like it at all but non the less a good place to come away from the traffic and shopping.

Beautiful!. Really enjoyed my visit. The paintings are beautiful. It is amazing how simple strokes of the brush can make art! Antonio Blanco even designed the frames himself. Plus.. The staff are really friendly. One volunteered to take photos of me while Augustin shared stories about Antonio and his family and told jokes that really made me smile.
Interesting Gallery & Museum. Interesting place to spend an afternoon - lots of nice gardens & plenty of unique art & birds to look at.

great place for art lover.. for art lover, i think this is a great place to visit because in there, blanco's paintings are shown to public especially it is renaissance art by antonio blanco, portraying bali and it's women in his perspective. we can't take photos in the museum. some pictures have descriptions on them to give the visitor better view on him and his painting.in the outside there's a mini bird park. we can take photos with the birds. the staffs are friendly and if you ask them to explain each painting they will comply with open heart.for me, who is not an art lover nor know art, i don't really enjoy being in there. haha.the architecture is great and the welcome drink is delicious.
Nice. Nice painting from the legend blanco, we will know more about him and exotic women that he paint. Beautiful
Worth a visit. Charming place, we really appreciated the painting style of Don Antonio. Worth a visit while in Ubud
A different art experience. Not your typical Indonesian Art exhibition, the Antonio Blanco collection set in a great setting is an east meets west experience.
Go there!. I just love this museum. The history video is a must see. The art is fantastic and the frames are amazing. A great family day out. The tame Tucans are fun for kids to feed and handle

A must for art lovers.. Although I have been there many times, I always will recommend Antonio Blanco museum to my friends if we're traveling together. The museum is a unique blend of art museum, home to rare birds and a beautiful forest-like restaurant.

Beautiful appreciation of work of a genius. For you who wants to see the work of a great artist, this is the right place for you, whether you are into art or not. Entrance ticket is affordable (only 30k). The staffs are also very friendly and funny. One of the staff, Ms Aprilia, even kindly told us stories behind late Mr Blanco's paintings and gladly answered all of our questions. Thank you!

Surprise package. This well kept museum is the home of a collection of the artist Blancos collection. It is really interesting. There is a collection of rarer Indonesian live birds and an artists play area too

Very sensual paintings /Beauty in the eyes of the artist. Instead of shopping in the crowded streets of Ubud town, a relaxing day for me and my friend was visiting the Don Antonio Museum located on Campuan Hill .You must have the staff around to explain the essence of the paintings which reflects Antonio Blanco s expressively sensual and I would say a little erotic mind. Special thank you to Komang Ani and Augustin who gave detailed explanation of the paintings and not forgetting each painting frame which Blanco made each frame as important and meaningful as the painting itself.Please remember to ask the staff to open those paintings that are locked up as you browse along each painting on the wall. You are in for a surprise.A cup of coffee and a plate of nasi goreng at the museum restaurant which overlooks the greeneries completed this lovely afternoon.

Antonio blanco museum. Amazing place with a wonderful paintings. I love them all. Very ethnic. I would like to visit again when i come to bali next year. And also thank you very much for Mr. Wayan who guide us. He's very funny and really helpfull.

Unique artist. All of his paintings is all about Balinese women. The staff, Wayan, helped us a lot explaining the meaning of each painting and their unique frames.Note: Some of the paintings might not suitable for children.

Horrendous conditions of captive birds. My husband and I visited the museum recently during a week long stay in Ubud. We were suprised at the entrance price which amounted to about $16 AUS for both of us. We are bird owners and lovers, and we were shocked at the condition of the cages and displayed birds. Almost none of the many cages had any water available at all!! Let alone food!! The aviaries were filthy and there was a verandah area in which young eclectus parrots and other assorted birds were crammed into tiny cages with no food or water. The food trays for the macaws were appalling amd summed up the incredibly poor diet on offer to them. The blue and gold macaw posing for photos with tourists was very underweight amd obviously prone to feather plucking. Seeing the birds treated in this way prevented us from enjoying the museum. Though the grounds and building were attractive, the art was hardly the work of a master artist. The building itself was obviously built as a shrine to the artist's inflated ego. Based on the treatment of the birds I will not recommend this place to anyone. Better to spend your money visiting Bali Bird Park or another of Ubud's art museums.

Terrible conditions of birds. Though the grounds of the museum were pretty, the treatment and captive conditions for the birds was an abomination. Scarcely any of the cages or aviaries contained water and many had no access to any food whatsoever. THe cages were filthy and barren, and the macaws on display for photographs with tourists were clearly underweight and malnourished. IT was a tragic scene and animal lovers should stay clear. The entrance fee was WAY overpriced. We are ahed to have given our money to this place.
Not everone s taste.. Hmm..is a bit couriously..but should be visit too , and make own opinions for .Nice garden , and a bit freaky also inside.

A great visit in Bali... erotic and exotic painter and lovely birds.. Very interesting place to visit in Ubud. Definitely not what you expect to see. ... antonio blanco was a very 'interesting ' man,,,, erotic and unusual style of painting, gorgeous grounds, lovely building and a chance to get up close to exotic birds.
ART ART ART. Nice are with specific climate. Painting of Antonio Balno is amazing. Museum is close to the Ubud centre, you can just walk there.

An honest and lustful Artist. The property is very well maintained and managed. They charged Rp. 30.000,-/pax from 6 yo up, nice & intriguing welcome drink is included. And upon entrance you will find a beautiful garden, with some beautiful birds....tame and friendly enough to stand on your shoulder and let you pose for some pictures. You can seat on the chairs arrange in corners of the garden to enjoy the view.The museum is in side a main building, and I think...I regretted that I visited this place with my young son, It's my fault that I did not look up about what kind of art has brought Don Antonio Blanco into fame. I admire his honesty and his boldness to express. But to him...women is an object, just like any chauvinist male....and this museum really open my eyes.

Absolutely worth a visit!. Very nice and interesting place to visit. Not just because of the paintings and to learn about the work and life of the eccentric Don Antonio Blanco. But also because of the surrealistic building, surrounded by beautiful gardens with exotic birds, and the great views from the restaurant area. We went back for dinner and cocktails, which was also great!

Not a must see. for Australians, this guy's paintings are a little reminiscent of those of Norman Lindsay (ie lots of busty ladies) but not as good. The house itself though is quite interesting but there are plenty of better things to do in Ubud. I'd only bother if you have a spare hour and you're in the area

The Dali of Bali. Amazing art museum/gallery of the works of the eccentric Antonio Blanco. The location brilliant as donated to Blanco by the king of Bali at the time, wonderful structure with great views up the Campuhan Valley. Blancos studio also on display.
memorable. the Dali of Bali...a museum and art collection you will not forget. His works is displayed in a fashion to capture ones fantasy. The location is near town and truly worth a visit.

Antonio Blanco Museum. I'm not really know about arts, but I've heard about Mr. Blanco several times from the media. It was a nice visit. Most of Mr. Blanco's painting were about the beautiful of women and Bali. Interesting. He can translate about the beauty to a canvas. I love the place. It has a beautiful garden. Many good spots to take pictures. They have also some birds, which you can take pictures with. My children were love it.

Lovely museum!. I really liked my visit to the don Antonio Blanco Museum. When I arrived, they made a picture of me with really big birds.The paintings are just wonderful and I'm not really a art loving person. You also get a good view when your upstairs.
Lovely afternoon. Very interesting place to visit and beautiful gardens to enjoy. The restaurant is really nice and a lovely place to spend some time relaxing.

A surprise package. I had walked past this place many times and on a rainy day, ventured in to check it out. really worth it, its a a complete sanctuary, beautiful gardens, birds everywhere, then 2-3 floors of Antonio's art. If you are with kids be prepared to explain some of his erotic art, its very easy to see what he liked in the female form. All in all worth the entrance fee which was from memory $7.

A Palace-Museum. I've been here several times with friends and family. Everytime I come back, I always feel amaze with all the paintings, the building, the park and now the birds! They now have a restaurant in front of the museum, overlooking the Campuhan hill, it's really stunning! The staff are always friendly. They don't allow you to take photos but some replicas of the paintings are available for sale.

Interesting but wouldn't recommend as a must-see. Art is so subjective, so it really depends on individual tastes, but this wasn't a wow on my trip. It's interesting to see if you have the time, otherwise would give it a miss. What I liked most were the portraits and the frames themselves. What I disliked the most was the mixed-media and the Michael Jackson inspired art.

More than a gallery. beautiful gardens with birds, amazing views from the roof. Palatial building with incredible display of Blancos work. Definitely not a great Master but made a huge impact on the art scene at that time

interrested in art? blanco museum is a must do!. the blanco museum has a very nice atmosphere. I liked the roccoco charming style of the house, also the beautiful garden with the parrots :-) I would say for a museum it is small, but I would call it a BIG gallery. well, the entrance is quiet expensive for bali!for me the art is very progressive, when i looked at the date of origin... blanco also designed the frame of every picture, sometimes its a part of the picture! ..and yes it seems he was inspired of the spaish painter dali!

Only if you like art ..... It's a nice gallery, with interesting background story/history. The ground is beautiful and well maintained, the bird collection is honestly the highlight if the visit for my young children.We don't know much of art hence i will comment on the architecture on the place more on the paintings.The gallery, the building and the decor are beautiful, the surrounding is very peaceful.They charge more for foreigner, much more ... I paid 30k rupiah and my husband paid 80k.Welcome drink included in the ticket price. I personally don't like the drink, some sweet sour concoction in a shot glass.I would only recommend you to go if you are into art. There are more interesting Balinese theme tourist attractions in and around ubud.

Visit only if you have extra time.. Conveniently located near Bridges restaurant. A funky museum with a small collection. Do not bother if you are interested in Balinese art. We felt the entry fee was high given the limited collection. The grounds however are interesting. Never the less there are several other museums of greater interest in Ubud

Beautiful place. Huge place very well maintained. We were only people there. Lighting isn't really set up for the art making it hard to see some of the pieces. Grounds are wonderful. You get a gift with your entrance fee. Seems like all the work in the museum is for sale so great place if you are looking for new stuff.
Dali on Bali. It is a beautiful museum that is not widely advertised. Also the restaurant is excellent. Thoroughly recommend.Beware- there are erotic paintings everywhere!

Bit creepy. When I visited this museum, there were only me and my husband as the visitors, well we visit quite early though around 10 am. Basically the paintings are quite well-maintained but maybe it's just not my preference so I don't really enjoy it. The buildings (it's actually former house of Don Antonio) quite creepy since it was so quiet. But at the end of the tour, you can buy an A4 size of reproduce painting of Don Antonio's son with only 20-25k rupiahs.
Soft porn artist gallery. A Spanish artist who's love of the female form created and painted extraordinary artworks that could be in playboy magazine! Hilarious! Yet interesting...

Remarkable building. It's worth walking up the steep driveway from the street just to see this unique building, unlike any other in Ubud. The collection of the artist's works has some themes in common, particularly the beasts of young women. A couple of the works are graphic enough to Balinese sensibilities to warrant some hinged doors covering these paintings.

Not friendly. I walked there, and they are a way outside town, and then up a steep hill. I was very tired when I reached the top, and the staff was so unwelcoming that I turned around and left. I don't know what I missed, but felt too abused to go inside.

Really gorgeous grounds and studio. Fascinating to see Blanco's studio and gallery. The grounds are beautifully kept and the free drink and nibbles with entry pass makes it most worthwhile. Sit overlooking the bridge and Tjampuan valley, looking out to Clear Cafe and bustle of people below.

Great History with Great Hospitality. This museum showed the paintings of Don Antonio Blanco and his son Mario Blanco. In this museum we were guided by Ms. Agustin that told us about the history about this museum and it's owner. She also told us the absolute details of Bali's traditional cultural that related to the paintings. It's nice to know other people's traditional culture.

Blanco Museum is a very nice place to see in Ubud. The Galery or Museum of Antonio Blanco is really nice to see, I like to take a walk along the garden is very amazing with many of Kakadu. We can also have Ginger Tea along the gate to the entrance of the Museum.

Amazing hospitality and great paintings. The hospitality of the staffs is amazing! From the ticketing counter person, people at welcome drinks , and the tour guides.We had a very informative, friendly, and funny guide, Mr. Wayan. He had an extensive knowledge of the paintings, history, complete with great humour. He even assisted us in taking pictures at pretty spots.My family and I had a great time. Definitely worth visiting!

Love the birds and the soap. I really love the old soap. They have it! I wish I can take a picture of the soap and show it to my mum. She will be really happy. I think my most fav part is the soap and the birds.

Museum with a view. I was so amazed with the hospitality. From the parking area, the lady at the ticket counter, the man who assisted the welcome drink, until the ticket checker in the museum, they were all soooo polite and they served us so well. What amazed my friend and I is because we're only 3 teenagers but they treated us the same like they treated foreign tourist. And it's one thing we appreciated so much! And the museum was so great. The view, the architecture, the atmosphere, the garden, everything was one good package for another kind of trip you'll love.

Fascinating. The Blanco Gallery is interesting from an art perspective and is housed in a building that adds another dimension. The history of the gallery is a story in itself. For those interested in Indonesian and art this is something you should consider doing,

For the in you. Altho we are not really into art we like galleries and the buildings. This is an interesting amazing building with lovely gardens. Personally I loved the quirky frames the best! Very unique! The guides will show you through Blancos house and studio- a very unique & interesting style he had and his son is carrying this on.

Great visit. We had never heard Antonio Blanco before BUT thanks to our amazing guide Komang Ani we had the best time visiting this place. She was funny and so interesting to listen to, she explained all the paintings and frames, we really feel like we know the artist a bit more now! Viva Blanco!

an amazing artist expression as a heart of ubud. Blanco meseum as we know different from another attraction in bali specially in central of ubud. Visit ubud is not fully completed if you not interact with blanco meseum. Why interact because since we stepping in the stone patch of meseum you will feel the greeted warm of all the staffs. Even a green touch of beautiful park and friendly birds. Bottomline mr. Blznco bring a truly romansa with his loving wife and painting to you in person. Assured you will not regret.

Sagging at the edges. We take friends here whenever they come to Bali but the most recent was the last time. I always enjoyed the eccentric art and architecture but last time the poor birds were looking worse for wear and the back cages were bare and neglected. A bit depressing. I'll take my art at Puri Lukisan or ARMA from now on
World class painting. Nice place to see world class painting and with good explaination from Ms. Agustina the guide.. must visit in Ubud

Amazing man and museum!. I'd never heard of Antonio Blanco before but so glad we went there. Very interesting and provocative paintings. The staff are informative and fun. The building is awesome and beautiful restaurant. Well worth going to!
Amazing Arts!. This place is very nice for everyone who likes art. Hornbill & parrots can stand on your arms and take picture with them.

Eccentric. We went because the photos looked eccentric and it was. But I didn't care for his paintings tho the frames were crazy and original . The building itself was sometimes beautiful and the big hornbill and parrots who would sit on your arms were a treat. The dragon stair case was also pretty amazing but don't knock yourself out trying to get there in my opinion tho not expensive for what it was .

Worth every penny!. I have no idea what the people in these message boards are talking about!For only 80,000 IDR (~£4 in June 2015) you get entrance to a magical art gallery, a free drink in the luscious restaurant and breathtaking views over the whole of lower Ubud. Blanco's impressionistic style might not be to everyone's tastes, but the museum is so carefully laid out, and the frames complement all of the paintings wonderfully. The museum staff are also a great help, and are very knowledgeable. This place is absolutely worth staying at if you have a couple of hours to spare. The perfect way to escape the beating heat of the Balinese sun and the crowds of Central Ubud.
Frames are catching the eyes more than paintings. Not my type. In front of the entry, If you request, hornbill & parrots can stand on your arms for a pic by free.

Went for the landscape. I reviewed some of the art online first. I was not so interested in the art as I was mostly interested in the landscaping at this location. The grounds are lovely and there is a very picturesque restaurant on the grounds, (which I did not eat at), that has stunning views.

Nice museum. Great place to spend an hour or so look at the art and beautiful sculptures around the museum. Get a free drink at the restaurant and pose with the birds from the bird park. Nice place however I question the treatment of some of the caged birds.
homage to himself. An interesting collection, well worth the time and entry fee. Blanco had obvious talent and an eye for the female form.

Beautiful place!. Interesting combination of Renaissance and Balinese tropical surrounding.
18+
After exhibition you will be offered to enjoy a complimentary drink in a nearest restaurant with outstanding view. By the way, on certain days you can see Balinese dance in this restaurant for free.
nice museum. the museum is set on a lovley hill and well worth the price of entry if only to climb to the roof for a 360 deg view of ubud
Not suitable for kids. it's not suitable for kids since there some nude portrait in here. beside the paintings, they got a lot of birds here. some of them are quite exotic.

Solid Art Museum. Decent museum overall. Definitely a western artists take on Balinese life and culture. I though it was a little expensive for what was offered, but still a good choice for travelers to Bali.

Very interesting exploration of work of Dali and Bali. It is quite a special experience, several story villa dedicated to life and works of Antonio Blanco is quite unique in its atmosphere. Don't miss the outside stairs to the top floor with the views of Ubud. Though for Ubud the admission is quite expensive around 10 USD, but if you like funky art it is well worth to see and explore this special place.

Beautiful Garden. Stunning Art.. We spent the morning mesmerized by the unique creativity of Antonio Blanco and his son. The gardens are beautiful, the staff friendly and the welcome drink included in the entrance fee of only Aus $8 was delicious. Definitely worth a visit!

Love it!. Ubud is so lucky to have all these nice museums... they have 5! As soon as I saw in the travel blogs that Antonio Blanco has a museum in Bali, I just had to see this. I love the paintings, it has a romantic feel about them. I am not an art connoisseur so will not pretend and give critiques of his paintings. However, I love his story on how he came to Ubud. He seemed like a fun, eccentric old gentlemen. I love the collage he made when he met Michael Jackson!The grounds are beautiful with opera music piped in around the museum and the courtyard. I sat on the bench for quite sometime just listening and feeling the vibe of the place. Since it was lunchtime I decided to get my lunch at Ronjini Restaurant and had Mie Goreng. The food was good and not expensive. Again, the vibe was great with lounge music this time.Do not forget to visit this museum when you visit Ubud.

Definitely the Dali of Bali - if you like art, don't miss this place. What a surprise. Having not known about Antonio Blanco until our visit to Bali I was surprised that he is not well known. A real master of the 20th century. The keepers of his estate have done a brilliant job to preserve and showcase Blanco's legacy, but they keep it local. If only they would let images of his works be more widely distributed, Blanco deserves the world's adulation.

Eccentric "Dali of Bali". Antonio Blanco was a larger than life figure in Ubud and his paintings are sensual, some erotic mainly of women. His Balinese wife was a frequent muse and features on the front of the brochure. Even the frames are a work of art, all hand carved with incredible detail often relating to the painting they frame. The building is sumptuous in design and the two floors are open and airy. Climb to the top floor, up the circular staircase for stunning views over the river and ridge and admire the golden statues around the perimeter. Wander through the luscious gardens and finish with a complementarydrink in the restaurant ( named after his wife)and perhaps a snack to stay longer in the quiet surrounds. An enriching experience and enjoyable few hours in the tranquil area.

The maestro's spirit pervades.. Don Antonio Blanco Museum is high on my must visit list whenever I visit Ubud. The main pavilion (two floors) houses a wide collection of the maestro's works (some are prints of the originals and it has to be pointed out the many of the works on display are erotic in style and in content); and the building is exquisite, quiet and cool. On the top floor of the pavilion you can go out onto the balcony where you will get a wide view of the Campuan locale but if you're game and fit enough you can climb the spiral steel stairs onto the roof and have an even better view. I had the pleasure of meeting Antonio Balnco (three times) and also had the privilege of seeing him paint in his old studio which is connected to the new pavilion. The grounds are also exquisite - cool green lawns, shaded areas to just sit and relax or sketch and you will also receive a complimentary cool drink which is served in the open restaurant. The staff are a delight and you can also order snacks,meals and other drinks there.

Overesteemed and very particular., sometimes joining the bad taste!. The paintings are not all originals ,many are reproductions , entry fee 85000 rupees excessive for what it is ,comparing to other museums in BaliThe palace is painted in very gaudy colors , and globally the paintings have little artistic value; on the whole ,the museum is well entertained and the conditions of the exhibition are good , nice view from the terrace upstairs and nice garden and restaurant...I think there are some more interesting museums in Ubud if U like art

Well worth a visit, also try the restraurant. Amazing artist, beautiful garden, very interesting. We also ate at the restaurant one night which was very good and if you go on a Wed or Friday night there is Balinese dancing which i thoroughly recommend
Interesting museum. The museum is located in a beautiful area on the hill near the famous Bridges restaurant. It is well laid out and interesting.

Balinese picture. The ticket entri 80000 rupiah is enjoying many picture of bali island picture, good atmosphere, naturally, go to top floor, you can see padi field is wonderful indonesia agriculture, you can eat rice from padi after visit a museum at bridge restaurant, delicious, enjoy that

Great Visit - Loved It. Really enjoyed our visit to The Blanco Renaissance Museum (Entrance IDR 80,000. Open daily 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.) Interesting architecture, beautiful grounds, lovely to weird paintings and picture frames. The deceased artist Don Antonio Blanco was described as The Dali of Bali for good reason. Really interesting museum which I highly recommend.

Combination of Spainish and Balinese. The Blanco Renaissance Museum (IDR 80,000 and 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily) is a dream world of Don Antonio Blanco (The Dali of Bali). Now only the museum is open to the public and no photo inside. Blanco's paintings usually express his adoration of woman, little variations exhibit. Each picture has its own frame designed by Blanco, full of artistic merits. Without the help of a guided lady, you may not see two pictures behind the locked panels, more than that she will also give you a better understanding of the collection. Trained bird sits on your shoulder so that you can take a beautiful picture. A free drink is also offered at the nearby restaurant.

Delightful, sensual experience. I loved visiting the Blanco museum and regretted that I'd missed it so far on my trips to Ubud. Much more than a gallery, you get to look into the life of this fascinating man and his family and to top it off with a drink (and more if you wish) at the restaurant with great service and a wonderful view. And his art is glorious IMHO. Sensual and sumptuous, each piece is has a frame designed by Blanco and carved by local craftsmen with hidden jokes and cheeky additions that add to the story of the painting. If you can, get the guided tour from the beautiful young lady who looks after the gallery. It added so much to my understanding.

Beautiful hause! Not varied painting!. I like the place, beautiful old yet modern hause. So i know if antonio blanco was a rich and legendary artist in ubud. But the painting was kinda boring. He didnt have varied theme for his painting. But it's a must visit place in ubud. For your unique experience in ubud!!
worlds coming together. Interesting story behind the museum that brings together classic art and local culture. As well the kids like it (maybe bacause of the beauful Ara at the entrance?).

Damn, Antonio knew how to live.... His artwork is fascinating, hugely talented, beautiful. But I was particularly taken by the Shangri-La feel of the estate. From the exotic bird collection, gilded statuary, and glorious views from the mansion, this dude knew how to live large !
A Must in Ubud. Very beautiful house. It is a pity we can't take pictures inside ! So beautiful, the frames of paintings. Take time to relax in the parc.

Museum of painting. Antonio Blanco was a really popular painter in Bali. Originated from Europe, he moved to Bali and married a Balinese woman. His paintings are now displayed in this museum. If you like fine arts you should visit this one.

For those who loves painting and art. It's a place where you not only see the painting of Don Antonio Blanco and his son, buat also have a great view when you up to the third floor of this building. The main gate before entering the museum is cool

Fine Art Museum. Overt he years the Blanco talented artistic family have continued to add creative art works to this most interesting of Museums it is well worth a visit for those of you who love art .
What a Fantastic Place. Beautiful place, Garden, Birds, Paintings, and the Restaurant. But stairs, not suitable for elderly and not for wheelchairs.

No photos allowed - with good reason!. Don Antonio loved painting women and this museum is filled with them. What makes it so special is that the frames form a part of the total - whimsical, beautiful, sensual and such an interesting place to visit. You will not be disappointed.

Not worth it. The grounds are nice, and the entrance to the museum (walking through the legs of an enormous sculpture) was fun, but the art was very disappointing to me - just paintings by the one artist (Antonio Blanco) which seemed repetitive and of modest skill. When you can't make paintings of naked Balinese women interesting, you're in trouble.

But is it good art or bad art.. People will never agree.I'm in the 'yes' camp.The guy obviously loved to paint nude women. So did a lot of old masters - titian, Goya, Botticeli, velasquez. Big deal. Their paintings certainly don't raise a fuss in the National Galleries or wherever they end up. That's all this guys doing. I quite liked his use of colour in them. But he's not just about nude portraits. There's lots of other artwork there too, and it's easy to see surrealist influences. As someone mentioned, check out some of the frames too? I guess it was inevitable they would come up with the 'Dali of Bali' term. But he could obviously turn his hand to more classical representations - the guilded statues perched on top of the museum (I'm assuming that was him too.) for instance.I thoroughly enjoyed it. If nothing else, it's in a tremendous location. I wouldn't mind a bit of real estate there!
Quaint place. Very interesting to see, what created an european artist in Bali. The other side, you can get introscpection of balinese life in mid twentieth century.

A paean to hideousness.. Wow. I just don't know where to begin to describe this shrine to the confluence of narcissism, grandiose delusion, misogyny and ephebophilia. Oh, and the art isn't that crash hot either.To get to the museum - which is more Vegas than Vatican - you walk through a lush garden of exotic birds, which appear to have been sedated or stapled to the trees (or both), and underneath a monumental triumphal arch, which is the artist's 'signature' - like a Stalin commission to Gaudi.The art gracing the walls consists mainly of half naked mid-to-late adolescent women, some supine, engaging in various interesting - but not family friendly - activities. Initially I thought the frames surrounding the artwork had been created by a mescaline addled arts co-operative, but no, the artist took credit for those as well.Luckily you can get through this all rather quickly - 30 minutes is enough - provided that the naff Three Tenors muzak doesn't drive you out before that.I would give this 'attraction' one star, but its monumental hideousness caused a rupture in the time space continuum - a bit like a red giant star of kitsch collapsing in on itself causing a black hole in the fabric of good taste - such that this, most certainly, was the most amazing thing my mere human eyes have ever witnessed to date. 5 stars!(Oh and the gift store is pants too).
Quite a spectacle. An amazing place! The artwork is well presented, and the grounds and building spectacularly over-the-top.

Loved it so much had to go back. What I love about this art museum is that it just gets better the second time around - when I visited they were doing huge renovations - the restaurant was closed which is the only place to get food - I have fallen in love with this museum it has captured my heart - I am inspired by the creativity of the place - outside the bird life and animals adds to the richness - I want to keep it a secret so it doesn't get over run with visitors - I definitely will be going back

stunning. I was shocked and amazed. It's hard to believe, that European art can get such a shape and energy in the other side of the world. If you are in Ubud - go and visit this museum without any doubts!

Must be seen to be believed. There's really no point in trying to explain what's going on at this place. You can pay them to find out, or you'll always wonder. The misguided grandeur of the narcissistic delusions on display here is something to behold in and of itself. Undoubtedly the most misogynist art "institution" I've ever been to.

A wonder fantasy visit.. I walked up then I'll from the main road and from the first I was impressed by the grounds and thecresto where I had my complimentary drink. Signage from the rest is a bit lacking but you can't get lost.as I entered the main building, I was blown away by the vibrant coloursofnot only the paintings and frames but also the walls and moldings. This is a place that has been designed to showcase the flamboyant life of Antonio Blanco and it succeeds abmirably. There's some questionable content but if its unsettling then just move on. I had a great visit and made sure that I had seen everything before I existed the main building as you can't re enter

Not for who is not fan. I only enjoyed the welcoming drink (very nice) and photos with the parrots. The painting were about indonesian women beauty (mostly naked women) and they didn't use air conditioner inside the museum ( which quite hot and made me wanna exit the museum quicker)

Don Antonio. Great exhibit. Really worth it to understand the culture of two worlds united by art and power. There are different rooms and it's a big palace. You can appreciate the art and the architecture of the region as well.

Interesting. Beautiful architecture and build. Beutiful artwork from a talented father and son. We stumbled upon it but happily paid the 8 nzd per person entrance fee. Photo opportunity with the parrots etc was novel and the views are beautiful. Well worth a visit

Ghastly!. Where do I start? The guy was clearly a pretentious lech, he did have talent, but his paintings are very dated now. I don't mind about the semi-naked women in Blanco's paintings, they are all pretty innocent, but it was very boring indeed. If you find it too sexy for kids, I beg to differ - my 7 year old thought the "bare ladies" were a hoot! It's a monument to a gigantic ego, and the disturbing sight of the birds shackled to perches only adds to the horror! The site is great but really, AVOID.

animal cruelty. I confirm what other posters have said about the disgraceful treatment of birds (apart from the free range miniature chickens and 1 pea hen). Caged birds were housed in appalling conditions, and the parrots just inside the entrance did appear to be unable to move much-I didn't want to get too close, as I found them a distressing sight. Gardens were very nice, some artwork interesting (some definitely not 'family-friendly'), but all that really sticks in my mind is the poor birds. Cafe was pleasant enough. I just submitted a complaint through their website. If you have ever visited and were disturbed by what you saw, please consider doing the same! Future visitors could also comment in the guest book or alert staff. Without the birds I would have rated it 3.5/5.

Renaissance Arts. Tge best museum in Ubud displaying a lots of paintings in Renaissance style. Don Antonio and Mario Blanco definitely one of the best maestro(s). It displaying a lots of inspiring paintings, though some paintings are about erotic desire. The view from the restaurant within this Museum is beautiful. Must visit this museum. The entry fee aren't expensive. Around USD $3 / IDR 30,000 per pax including welcome drink.

A very different museum. Blanco's museum is worth a visit if you want to see something totally different to Balinese art. The setting, building and views from the restaurant are beautiful. Antonio Blanco paintings include portraits, Balinese danders and many erotic ones and his frames are very out of the ordinary and quite unique whether you like them or not. There are spectacular tame birds like toucans from Kalimantan, black cockatoos from Western Australia as well as many other colourful birds walking or sitting around outdoor open perches who appear very happy in their surroundings. For 80,000rupiah or about $8 you get to see the gardens, birds and museum and have a welcome drink in their restaurant which overlooks the renovated temple opposite.
Terrible. Sleezy, maybe appeals to some people... like michael jackson. Art is below average & tacky, ugly architecture, live birds are pinned to the trees, but the view from the cafe was nice.

Eccentric yet artistic. Antonio Blanco's life and artistic products are the central focus of this museum. Although this may not be an appropriate place for younger kids, but his uniqueness is the one that make this museum a must visit in Ubud.

Must See. Antonio Blanco..what a life he led. Everyone MUST view his old world style masterpieces and his off color collection as well. His poetry, writings and observations of life can never be duplicated. Honored to have met him many years ago. What a talented, lucky man. Buy his book on site.

A surprising treasure to find in Ubud. What an excellent celebration of this artist's work and life. Low admission charge is well worth it. Museum also has a restaurant and features occasional live performances.

Not sure why we went. Essentially a display of a European expat representing his desire for a hedonistic lifestyle as art. Not worth the money for the tour. The kids liked the parrots, but the art and the restaurant were not worth the walk

What an Unexpected & Delightful Experience. The gallery is stunning and very unexpected. I have been to Bali now 12 times and never visited the Museum however, the unexpected aspect of this visit resulted in lunch and a few days later dinner in the stunning restaurant in the grounds of the Museum. What a find - this is a definite must see.
Must see museumin Ubud. This was an awesome museum. Antonio Blanco's artwork was amazing and even everyhting about the place was magnificent. The building, the gardent was nicely done

Dumbstruck!. Am not a painting expert or fan.This is my 2nd visit to an art museum. We passed by the arch that showcase the museum while walking towards Bintang supermarket. Entrance fee is steep，but when saw The Maestro masterpiece 1 by 1,I was totally amazed by his talent& deep illustration. Even The frames are designed by Blanco himself,totally displayed his commitment towards art,few of it are award winning paintings. His working station&workshop is well preserved for visitation & minimal souvenirs are sold on site.

Beautiful artwork interesting history. The artwork is beautiful and provides interesting perspective to balinese history and culture. Very informative and friendly staff. And there are some beautiful birds in the gardens
Interesting place to visit. I've been there before. It was an amazing and beautiful painting.I would recommend to go visit there and you will feel how gorgeous is.
nice relaxing grounds. good way to spend a relaxing afternoon after a hectic morning of shopping, nice park like grounds, bird life etc

interesting place. really nice location and beautiful surroundings with exotic birds. beautiful paintings. We found the entrance fee (80,00 roupies) to be quite expensive although they offer a welcome drink with it in their nice restaurant.

Confused. When it comes to art, for sure it's very subjective. But I'm sure I do have a strong sense of art. This place made me confused with those paintings. Well, probably just not my style, but I think repeating the same theme on every painting is not really interesting. Well, the venue itself look okay. Big building, big garden.

A highlight. This museum is stunning, everything about the building is beautiful, artwork amazing, beautiful birds in the garden, the original home of Antonio Blanco has been preserved & it was very interesting to follow his life. Our hostess was extremely informative & friendly

Proof that Bali is on the art scene. Often you hear about the famous countries of Spain, Italy, France with the best art. Surprisingly when you come to Bali expect incredible art in galleries, museums, on the street, in hotels/restaurants- the beauty of Balinese art surrounds you with education on its culture, religion, history, and daily lifestyles. With this said, the artist who spread awareness to the talent and potential of the Balinese art scene was Antonio Blanco. He was passionate about sharing his gift with the world and wanted people to promote Bali as not just a tourist destination, but an artistic wonderland. The museum he created has thought behind each and every detail- the frames to the three levels being the mountain, tree, and sea( I think have those right). The frames that are described as "Gawdy" were all designed by him with unique connections to the painting. The erotic paintings may have been a little overwhelming for some, but even those had significance. He was definitely not egotistical when 90 percent of the art was of his wife, friends, celebrities, or Russian/Japanese models. From a complete art snob who has seen museums, galleries, and met artists from all over the world- this man had talent. He was not a sell out trying to make money. If that was the case he would be selling his art to big museums and put himself in all the big cities. He is not Salvador Dali, but they definitely have their similarities and incredibly creative minds. Yes, the admission is a bit high in comparison to other galleries, but you are paying for an experience and need to take time to enjoy the art- when you can appreciate it that will make it worth it. If the gallery is not impressing you; then there are beautiful grounds to walk around and listen to the birds. The restaurant has beautiful views, amazing staff of people, great food and drinks and if you go on Sunday they have brunch followed by a BBQ with great electronic music DJ. Agreed, the drink needs to be replaced with something refreshing and not so strong. After spending 4 hours there between the museum and restaurant, having a guide, speaking with the staff that work there both inside the museum and In the restaurant- I learned about what goes on there and I witnessed as I watched people go around the museum(psychoanalysts watch everything).People don't know how to properly view art. If you expect to look at a painting and understand it by looking for 3 seconds and going on to the next- you shouldn't be in a museum. I watched several people laugh at the paintings- not reading the poetry, not with a guide, and with groups socializing. Not a quite experience there as people are talking loudly with no censor. I spoke with the woman in the studio and she said the same thing I just wrote above and this was my observation before she said it. People just don't appreciate art enough- not just here but in many museums. I'm not sure what people expect when they don't know the significance because they don't try to learn about it. Did anyone pay attention to his two signatures, the colors of paint and the changes between the female body, his multiple family photos? What about his son who is equally as talented and walks around the property open to share and have people learn? People don't take advantage of opportunities and then they complain and make false accusations. Everyone is entitled to their own opinion, but make sure you see the big picture before you comment. I highly recommend seeing this museum. Take time to talk with the staff who are lovely and welcoming, get a guide, spend time going around a couple times, and enjoy a nice relaxing view from the top and a drink-ginger lemonade is amazing! -PCR-

Finally Im here. I always wondering about this particular museum. You can tell how Antonio Blanco blend with Balinese culture. I like everything here and took a lot of good pictures. Make sure you enter the front door of the museum so you will get a guide who explains the work of art to you. We entered from another door, so we didnt get the explanation. There is a restaurant inside it which is pretty good.

Tasteless. This "museum" is just a money-making machine inspired by the paintings of Don Antonio Blanco, who had way more ego than talent. Overall the artistic value of the pieces is close to none. The painter, who awarded himself with the nickname "the Dali from Bali", is to the surrealist painter what Il Divo is to the Three Tenors.To make things worse, the interiors are pompous and kitsch (Liberace-kitsch), the surroundings are so-so and the free iced-tea that comes with the entrance fee is so sweet that could transform a healthy person into a half-dying diabetic with only one sip. Ah, don't forget that the entrance fee is an astonishing 80.000 IRD.Stay away from it.

Overpriced monument to inflated ego. OK, I had a bit of fun in this so-called "museum", although the creator and subject of this monument to his own genius must have been a sleazy egomaniac. The paintings are more or less competent kitsch, displayed in gilt-heavy frames. The reason to visit is the completely over the top main building - Liberace baroque or something like that. The place is good for a laugh, but hardly worth the 80.000 rp entrance fee.

the simpler the painting. Don Blanco's painting, over the year gets simpler, but better. His masterpieces are very simplistic painting but perfect! Highly recommended for every art lover!Sorry no photos inside the museum!
Just Ok.. If you're into erotic art, you can pay a visit. Artist is compared with Dali, I agree. A Dali fan would find this museum very interesting. Beautiful birds by the garden. Nice outdoor area.

Speechless moment to be remembered. I should put this place as one of my perfect sanctuaries. I even cried because of his exquisite masterpiece. Walking around for almost five hours and ended up drinking (I forgot what was the name) with a decent scenery around.

The Bali Dali. Very impressive house and gardens. The art is also very interesting each painting or drawing has an exquisite frame that is in itself a work of art. Loved the studio where the "Don" worked. Recommend this to all.

Wonderful paintings. I had never heard of him and really liked his work, so for me it was well worth it. My 14 year old son said it wasn't his style but you could tell he was really good. It is not a big museum and if you have small children they can stay looking and holding the beautiful birds they have outside or playing in the grounds whilst you take turns to look at the art. We ate at the restaurant which was good but not as wonderful as I expected it to be, but the view compensated for that.

Strange place. Interesting modern building in a traditional style but I did not much like the work of Antonio Blanco and I got the impression that it was a slick family business rather than an artistic foundation. The best thing was the picture frames.
Love the birds. I'm not really into art. For me, it's boring. However, I love the birds. The welcome drink was really cool for the hot midday.
Stunning erotic images on display. Disliked the 80,000 entry fee but enjoyed the fine display of art and a suprising collection of uncaged parrots roaming about the place.

The best museum and art gallery. I have been visiting the blanco museum for many times and I always enjoy it. This place is like the place that you always want to visit because firstly I love the painting collection from the artist and secondly I like the structure of the building and the garden also friendly service from the owner and staff.
Magnificent Art. This is the first time I visit art museum and I'm so excited to see the beautiful paints by Antonio Blanco :D

So Sweet <3. I went there because my friend from Rondji and Bridges told me to. I only payed $3 and could enjoy all the paintings. The paintings and the frames were so unique and has its own story behind. We didn't allow to take pictures, but I really recommend you to go there, especially for your loved ones

Bali's Renaissence Home. The beauty of the setting, the wonderful gardens and the collection of McCaws and supersized parrots from around the world leave a lasting impression prior to entering the quiet sanctury of contempory work that sits alone in expressing the passion, flow and innate joy of Balinese culture.Sometimes lit like Rembrandt, styled like Dali with a freedom and flow that is truly unique, this is a must visit gallery and studio.

Go To This Museum With An Open Mind. Quirky, eccentric, maybe even slightly crazy are descriptors that defines the art & the museum of Don Antonio Blanco. Unique architecture, delightful Balinese statues, tropical gardens, magnificent views, & erotic art featuring the beautiful women of Bali. What more could you ask for? Go & spend a couple of hours letting your imagination run wild with conjecture what might have gone on inside this villa. Life is short. Have fun! It is obvious that Don Antonio did.:)Also, take some time to go to the lovely Rondji Restaurant on the museum grounds. Please, note that the museum & restaurant are not handicapped friendly. There are lots of stairs & a steep driveway.

Spanish Balinese mixed art !!. one of the best places where you can find grass, trees, birds, and the Antonio Blanco works in a unique mix.. enjoyable place,,, with overview to the history and staff of Antonio who was a skilled artist and drawing women from the local society. wonderful thing that his sun is following the father and do artist of drawing but sure not in the level of father.Antonio is a a great mixing model using the Spanish techniques with Balinese ladies drawing.... he is a great in drawing the breast where it looks 3D drawing.unfortunately ..taking photos inside was not allowed,,,,at the end of the visit , a nice balcony terrace is giving you a power and keep you enjoy time and weather,, some times at evening music will be double relaxation,,,
Crazy...wonderful!. We were fortunate to meet this eccentric and interesting artist before he died. Interesting paintings and an unique edifice indeed. Incredible birds too.

Fascinating setting for amazing art. Was surprised how intriguing it all was. Gardens, furniture, birds and the art was worth the visit. The aviary out the back a bit sad but to take the spiral staircase and see his statues with some of the scenery remaining wad a privelage.

I love it!. I love it all here. The welcome cool drink, the grounds, the art. Everything. It was really interesting to see the differences between the art of father and son together. There was also a short movie playing with English subtitles that told us a bit of the history of Antonio Blanco. Great value visit.
Interesting. This is one place that has improved by going more commercial , the dead Don would love what they have done .highly recommended .

One of the famoust artist in Bali. This museum originally was the house of Don Antonio Blanco. It is located at Bukit Campuhan, Ubud.
If you like painting i recommend you to go to this museum. Most of His painting are Half Naked Balinese Woman.
Surreal Artwork -. The grounds and architecture were beautiful, as for the artwork itself... perhaps not my taste but all in the eye of the beholder... interesting Michael Jackson piece!!!!

Really? 80,000IDR???. Visited the museum today. Definitely not worth the entrance fee. The museum is very small on the inside taking only a few minutes to see it all. The art on the walls were not that impressive. The architecture of the building was impressive though. Unless you are really into art and museums - this may not be worth the entrance fee for you either..

Great spanish influence art with personality. This is definitely another museum worth a visit during your Ubud visit. The artist sure has interesting personality reflected in his art. It will not take too much time to browse around, probably 30 minutes.

Balis Dali. All a little surreal, large parrots at the entrance, and a very kitsch museum full of the late artists slightly pervy works ( an attraction for naked Balinese breasts to the fore ). Wonderful .

Come for the frames, stay for the views.... The art was very underwhelming, I don't think Blanco is worth the entry fee but the grounds make up for that.After looking at an extremely small collection, all i one building with enough Versace couches to make you smirk walk up the external staircase and find a great view of Ubud!The frames are also ridiculously entertaining. So much so that they distract from the uninspiring art. The restaurant looked nice, it would probably be a great place for an early dinner but Bridges is right below and is awesome.

Magnificent. This art museum is spectacular, from the moment you arrive to receive welcome drink you feel like you have entered into another world. Large coloured parrots, extraordinary architecture and the long red carpet lead you to the gallery of Blancos art work. I was fortunate to see the artist working on new art pieces at the time of our visit. If you love art this place is not to be missed. A lot of stairs so if mobility is an issue this may be challenging as there are a lot of stairs leading to the entrance of the art museum.

Great to have seen.. The museum is great, it offers to go into the working area of Blanco, the old house, a great garden with birds and obviously THE villa with all his paintings. The style itself should suit you as it may seem all erotic but his style of painting is great.
A museum with naked women. Not worthy to the ticket price, only a small museum with full of women's breasts. Maybe it's more suitable for the artistic visitors. Just person view.

Do not go!. Worst art I have ever seen in my life! Save your $8 or give it to charity. Don't get me started on his themes. His main theme; Exploitation of women, the entrance is an archway depicting the female form as an insect and you enter thru between her legs. But objectifying and dehumanising women wasn't enough. His second theme is the exploitation of the Balinese people. Depicting nude or semi-nude Balinese women ( culturally, very conservative) with dildos. To add insult to injury I could hear a female Balinese guide explain these themes straight faced to a bunch of western tourists.The final act of horror and the main reason I took to review on TripAdvisor, was the cruelty in which they kept they're birds. Beautiful huge rainforest birds, cockatoos, peacocks and many more self mutilating in tiny cages with little or no water. Was truly disgusting. Really, really sad. So I say to any and all "do not go!"

Museum Blanco. This Museum is woth a visit just for the architecture. Antonio Blanco's art may not appeal to everybody but it certainlycreates interest! We were given a complimentary drink in the beautiful surrounds of the restaurant but did not stay for a meal.

Great art and architecture!. Love this gallery...great art great views and has a wonderful restaurant too! Book for dinner but the gallery closes around 5pm so get there early to spend at least an hour checking out blanco's surreal style of art ...the Dali of bali!

Need to visit at all costs !. Very pleasant location in the centre of Ubud. Excellent guide speaking good French. Lots of stories around Bianco's life in Ubud. We loved all the paintings which are greatly presented in that original building.
great presentation. feel like combination of painting art, nice garden and hospitality, you will get welcome drink while you walk around the museum.also enjoy time with parrots
Ostentations and overrated. The view from this museum is great but otherwise I have to say that I left feeling extremely underwhelmed and surprised at the extent of Blanco's self esteem.

Worth visiting. Antonio Blanco is called "The Dali of Bali " ;) And he really is ..In this museum you can see many of his orks, his studio, private rooms and also find out much about his life. The museum is located in an astonishingly beautiful place - a kind of house on a hill - surrounded by amazing flowers, and other plants. The view of Ubud from there is magnificent too. You can admire it while eating lunch after visiting the museum .

Quite interesting but they have to make more information or guide available for the visitor who come there. Quite interesting but they have to make more information or guide available for the visitor who come there. Most of the paintings that were displayed wasn't the original, because most of it has been sold or kept in the conservation room/storage.There is no sign board where we have to go after we finished sight seeing in the first floor nor the right/the best way to see the paintings. The should add more informations about the paintings and the painter (Blanco itself)
Art and Lunch.. A fabulous place to see some exotic art and birds. There is a lovely restaurant there for lunch overlooking the valley.

Needs more for price increase. This was my second visit, much the same, except for now 80,000 rp, they have built a new resturant and now you get a welcome yellow drink.The museum still good, they have put a few signs on the pictures now, well maybe they were all there but have fallen off.Should be someone who can answer questions, and look interested, max 1 hour. Worth the 50,000 the last time.

Out of the ordinary. Let's start saying it it worth the visit. But Antonio Blanco was a very particular kind of artist so I'm not sure anyone would appreciate his slightly irreverent touch... The house is really beautiful, and the garden too, for a couple of hours visiting. Included with the ticket there is a refreshing cocktail at the bar. All for 80000 rupees. It's a bit expensive, but I enjoyed it a lot.

A must see in Ubud. We are art enthusiasts but were not at all familiar with Blanco's work. We were delighted to spend several hours in the Blanco museum and immerse ourselves in his paintings and collages. His primary theme was the female nude which he represented in a very novel and sensual interpretative manner. His work is represented in a number of major world museum collections and is definitely worth a look. The frames he designed for his paintings are almost also worth a visit alone.

A unique museum for the Dali of Bali. When I first visited this place in the 1990s to view the art, the present main museum building wasn't there. However, I was lucky enough to have met Don Antonio then.This time, I brought along a friend and we got the Alaya resort shuttle service to drop us there. Walked through the lovely entrance and grounds and took pics with the colourful birds before arriving at the museum proper. The building was as flamboyant as the art and the few pieces of Versace furniture didn't look out of place! Enjoyed the paintings with their custom-made frames. Although hot at that time, the outdoor roof terraces with their golden dancer-statues and great views were definitely a highlight for me. After that, there was a small room of erotic art (which may not be for everyone), the artist's old studio, paintings by his son Mario and a shop. The video about the artist looked interesting but we skipped that.Ended the visit at the adjacent Rondji (named after his dancer-wife) restaurant to have the complimentary drink and stayed on for a nice lunch too. Then we walked farther up the road to the village of Penestenan - didn't enjoy that because of the traffic on the narrow road.

Well worth the stop. We are not generally attracted to check out art museums, but we are so glad we stopped in here. In typical Bali style these places can be a real surprise, the setting and buildings a gorgeous, the art is exceptional, they have an interactive bird area, a lovely restaurant ... we took the time to watch the DVD playing (about 1 hour) and learn about the life history of Don Antonia Blanco and how he came to be such a big name in Ubud - great story and well worth the investment in time here.
Cool place to visit!. This place is a must visit not the typical boring museum, but more of weird creative one. One of the highlights of the trip.

Varied Talent. I had no idea that Blanco had such a wide talent. There is an art style for everyone at his museum. I was particularly intrigued by the frames that he designed and the way that he incorporated them into the art piece. I am not an artist, but this was facinating to me.
Out of the ordinary. Surprising surroundings to some extraordinary art. The grounds of the museum are beautiful as is the house and the parrots. Well worth visit

Why visit Blanco Museum. Blanco was a world renowned artist. The museum was his old house and it had a beautiful garden (great for taking photos) Had complimentary drinks as well as helpful and informative staff who explained the significance of his works. Most of his works portrayed nudity and he has a real interest in the female form. Great place to visit in Bali!

Weird, but worth a look. The surrounding grounds of this unique museum are beautiful and impressive. Inside, the artist's style ranges from classic portraits to some seriously bizarre and sometimes disturbing stuff! His ability to capture faces and expressions makes one think they must be looking at a photograph at times, they feel so real. It's worth noting that many of the pieces are not just about the canvas, but the frame that surrounds and completes the piece as a whole, and are often done by the artist as well. Taking the time to read the fine prints of the last exhibit area will result in a lot of raised eyebrows and occasional "What the...?"s. I think that watching other viewers' faces while reading these peculiar pieces would also be extremely amusing. Mr. Blanco was definitely an interesting fellow!

Surprising restaurant!. Artist has very good technique and there were interesting concept, but I found the overly obsessive sexual theme and the later commercializations a bit overwrought.The museum ground is a wonderful place to take a break and the restaurant is a surprising find captained by a wonderful chef. Had light lunch after the museum visit and returned the same day for dinner! Dinner was fantastic with wonderful night view of temple across!

Interesting experience . Ended up going to the museum because it was recommended by a guy in a restaurant. Interesting artwork and great Balinese dancers statues. The artwork is nothing incredible, but what is worth seeing are the gardens, statues and view from the top floor.

Entertaining and Enlightening!. What an interesting museum! I had never heard of this artist before, and just stumbled into it on the way back to my guesthouse. Entrance fee 80,000 rp. Upon entrance there is a big beautiful very green open area. I believe Blanco was a bird lover because there are many many exotic large and small birdies around the museum, inside and out. In the open green area, there is a museum employee who, if you like, lets you hold the birds so you can pose for pictures. lol..I actually have a weird fear of large birds (why dont they blink!!!), but I sucked it up and took a pic. The art is erotic, so for those who have issues with the human body, you may not like it. I really enjoyed the art, but what made it amusing was the descriptions that Blanco added to some of the paintings. They made me laugh out loud. His descriptions of some of his pieces are pretty funny, and make you think. Another pro was the open roof accessed by an iron spiral staircase. Beautiful statues, beautiful view, great for pictures. Definitely worth a visit!

If you like Dali. Nice museum if you actually like to get some idea of the artsy region of Ubud. We didn't visit any other museums so no comparisons to match to but it was interesting. The surroundings with the nature of Ubud are nice and the building is interesting. The paintings are especially intriguing because the frames were also designed by Blanco. There is plenty to see here. The house is very remarkable in terms of style and color. Very different from the museums in Europe ;)

Blanco Museum won us over.. The Antonio Blanco Museum won us over as soon as we walked through the door. We loved this place and fell madly in love with the work of Blanco. You really must go for a visit.
Fabulous restaurant. a great view for drinks...we had dinner at Wayan that night and were full.. We watched dancers and gamelon show.

Huge unique place but. Nice grounds. Huge unique gallery. But the art work did not trip my trigger. But might be loved by others. He had a collage of painting and fabric and comments when Michael Jackson came to see him . It was kind of a shrine to him. Most painting looked like sketches, and water color of nude local women. His modern work, in the gift shop area, looked like horizontal and vertical color lines on canvas. I think , I did not get his drift. He was an unusual character, as depicted in his photos. He is extreamly forced as a bug eyed man. Barong the good god, is also bug eyed. Photos of his family were interesting. The help was good. There is a resturant there and a large collection of LIVE birds in different cages.

Facinating place. This museum was not what I expected. The artist was very eccentric and his paintings are really different. The museum building is gorgeous and the most unexpected thing was all of the beautiful tropical birds which you could hold and take picture with.

Interesting art. I felt the Museum was beautifully set out especially the gardens and the exotic birds. However the art I found was quite unusual, clearly the artist loved women, put in that way! However some of his son's pieces I enjoyed more. Personally I wouldn't bother going back, if only to have a drink in the next door restaurant with a beautiful view. Worth a visit once.

Literally the most random place I've ever been. Begins with exotic birds perched on stands for photos, which you later find are kept in tiny cages round the back of the building - totally unnecessary.The purpose built building is practically Disney-esque and lavishly decorated to within an inch of its life, Il Divo are the soundtrack in the gallery.The techniques used on the paintings are interesting and some are very nice, but overall it's very self-indulgent. The painter and his museums awards are positioned in prime places around the rooms. The views on the rooftop make the ticket price almost worth it.Exit is straight through the gift shop, followed by Blancos "workshop" which is again filled with photos (one with Michael Jackson which could explain a lot) and quotes about the painter ("the Dali of Bali' - I think not!).There are better art museums in Bali with real traditional Balinese art which would be a much more worthwhile trip.

Amazing. We went here on our honeymood trip right after the wedding on Jan 2012. It was amazing to see magnificent paints from a Legendary Painter. When we arrived, the museum gave a welcome drink and Kemboja Flower for us to put the flower in our head. Then we walking around inside the museum. Then before we leave this place, we take a picture with birds.

Nice exhibition. A view into the life of an artist, respectfully unique, though shows a very sexy side to the Balinese women... So not for families with young children and prudent eyes. But if you love art, it's a great stop for sure. With a beautiful view of Ubud.

great museum. this museum is not only provided u hundred pictures/paintings, but also beautiful architecture of the gallery,beautiful garden with birds collection, don't forget to take the welcome drink at rondji restaurant, the view is also awesome :)
ask for one of the guides to give you info. Fab place. Old Don Antonio was a 'character'. The guides offer hilarious info and background on the Don. Not for the easily offended

Lavish, baroque, a little gaudy, maybe even a little racey.. What a fun place to visit in Ubud. The Blanco is the monument/museum of Antonio Blanco. Paintings, sculpture, gardens, and even exotic birds. Go with an open mind and appreciate the opus of a Latino artist living in Ubud in the 1950s. I really enjoyed the studio room where the docent provides lemongrass tea for your comfort. The roof sculpture garden provides exceptional views of the Campuhan area of Ubud. Blanco's work runs the gamut from portraits to quasi-erotic paintings. He gently crosses the line into 'kinky'. I found it quite tongue-in-cheek.
