Very Eccentric. Amazing insights into the mind of a complex man. Interesting paintings, not really my cuppa tea, but really cool to see into his world and the way he lived his life.

Interesting. Interesting collection of paintings by a single artist living in Ubud from the 1950s. Antonio Blanco married a local dancer who was also his model. Very large building housing about 200 paintings.
Interesting collection. It is a bit of a riot. Highly eclectic paintings, almost all devoted to the female form, but with a touch of humour, and inventive frames. Certainly with going.
Interesting. Impressive museum devoted to the work of one artist who lived in Bali from the 1950s. His son is there now. You either love them or hate them - I personally liked them very much.
Fun place. Large museum devoted to an eccentric but talented Catalan painters works. Lovely grounds with exotic birds. Just over the bridge so a good place to visit after going to Murni's Warung.
The Dali of Bali. An intriging and inspirational artist's residence and gallery set on landscaped gardens full of beautiful bird-life.

go there for the free dance. 3 night a week, there's a free dance show. It's a nice show, other in town are 75000rb. You have better scene there (not a real temple) nice chair. They offer you drink and to go the restaurant next to this place. This is a very good restaurant (a little expensive for bali, but better quality, more european menu). You don't have to go to the restaurant if you don't want.

Interesting!. We stumbled upon this while riding back to the Ubud town. It's amazing to see all the paintings, the people he's met and the beautiful structure that his house is. Quite an interesting story about Antonio Blanco! My husband and I enjoyed it.

A real surprise. This museum was a real surprise. The building is ornate and the exhibition is beautifully presented. It is well worth spending some time here viewing the art on different floors and walking in the garden experiencing the collection of exotic birds. The museum is peaceful and a great place to have a break from frenetic Ubud.

Superb museum. Museums and galleries in Ubud are generally of a high standard but this is one of my favourite galleries. Don Antonio Blanco was clearly quite a flamboyant character and this museum certainly lives up to his reputation with its stunning grounds and beautiful displays. Definitely worth a visit!

Quite a lot of fun. In a magnificent settting this museum showcases one artist's work which you will probably either love or hate. Apart from being in Ubud, his work did not really follow in the Balinese tradition, but he was ceratinly very skilled. I enjoyed it.

Unexpected find. I really didn't expect to enjoy this place, but promised a friend to accompany her there anyway after we went to a restaurant in the area. I ended up having a great time and being really intrigued by the art.The birds outside are so stunning and almost worth the admission price themselves. A guide will happily place two birds on your hand and shoulder to pose for pictures if you'd like.The grounds are also beautiful and worth a poke around. Our admission included two drinks which we enjoyed at the restaurant upstairs with a beautiful view overlooking Ubud.The museum/gallery itself is the perfect size. I don't have much of an eye for art but do have a short attention span, and this place was just the right amount to look at. If you are able to strike up a conversation with the young employee, he is actually a wealth of knowledge and can give you much-needed insight into many of the pieces. He also hilariously showed us a bunch of the more X-rated features in the final room of the gallery, many of which are tactfully covered by other pieces of art and would go unnoticed without the guide drawing attention to them.I didn't necessarily love all of the art (and indeed found some of the poetry too vulgar and bizarre for my tastes), however I was certainly intrigued enough to look at almost every piece - a pretty rare museum experience for me.

Enchanting museum. This was a random pick by us, however we went in for a look and was enchanted by the Dali from Bali! Lovely restaurant, museum and his whole story was quite remarkable. Worth a visit!

Abominable treatment of birds.. 80k for tourists now and very few of the paintings have any sort of explanatory caption. The framed article on display which suggests visitors should be thankful to the Dutch colonizers because, aside from murdering thousands of Balinese, they didn't bring missionaries therefore visitors got to see lots of Balinese girls with bare perky breasts pretty much summed up the attitude of the place and the artist.They also have many obviously traumatised exotic birds; some on perches for photo opportunities, the rest in barren and filthy cages out the back in the "bird park." It was absolutely disgusting. I'm ashamed to have given them my money.
amazing place. set in a beautiful garden, blanco museum is housed in a wonderful building and has some amazing pieces created by antonio blanco - now run by his son

Adorable guide, humorous artist, creative artworks. I really enjoyed my time in the Blanco Museum, getting to know this talented and humorous artist. Many surprises all along the visit. The gardens, the birds, the architecture, the architecture, everything is colorful & creative. The guide was also adorable !

Antonio loved the female form. Really enjoyed this museum... more an art gallery. Antonio loved Balinese women and there are lots of paintings of nude women in this gallery along with slightly erotic poems. The "Dali of Bali" is an appropriate description for guy! The gardens surrounding the building are like an oasis as soon as you walk through the arched gateway. Lovely place to while away an hour or two.

Such an artist. Mr. Blanco is my kind of artist . A great mind and gifted hands . The museum itself has a nice garden and is a beautiful building . There's a lot of Blanco's art to stare at and the guy was such an artist . His local work will mostly show depictions of normal , daily and simple Bali life . . . but mostly women . Blanco loved the ladies and so do I . He also wrote a lot of funny and profound words which are often implemented in his paintings . I love it when an artist is both visually and intellectually challenging me , leaving freedom for my own interpretation . I would definitely recommend to visit this museum if you are an art/culture enthousiast !
Worth the stop. Very interesting and beautiful scenery. Not a "museum". Interesting back story to the whole place. Preserved from past.

An unexpected gem in Ubud. We certainly did not expect to find this gem in Bali. It is well worth the visit for the art, the story behind the artist and for the architecture of the buildings. It did titillate the senses with the power of the art, the way it has been displayed, and the frames which are part to the artwork.

Beautiful place occupied by an eccentric artist. I visited the Don Antonio Blanco Museum with eight adult family members in June 2014. While I had never heard of the "Dali of Bali", the museum grounds and the studio Mr. Blanco built on top of a mountain overlooking the Campuan River are indeed beautiful if not breath taking, I had difficulty appreciating Mr. Blanco's art. That is not to say that I did not enjoy my visit. The flora and the fauna on the Museum grounds were beautiful if not bordering on the surreal. I loved the many flower varieties that were blooming, as well as the many beautiful exotic birds. The building is unique and one can climb the stairs to the upper floors and admire at your leisure the many paintings, watercolors, collages and drawings on display. I noticed that Mr. Blanco took an "avant garde" stand in his art against alcohol, tobacco and drugs way back in the 1940's and 1950's. The price of admission is in my opinion reasonable. Besides, one is treated to a refreshing drink in the restaurant at the end of the visit.Glad I visited the Blanco Museum.

Impressive!. Walking into the Blanco museums grounds, we were greeted by an array of beautiful colourful birds in a luscious green garden. A lovely Balinese man put the birds in our hands, shoulders and attempted for another on the head. The artwork inside the gallery was really lovely as well, main focus on paintings of Balinese dancers by Don Antonio Blanco. We enjoyed a free drink at the Rondji restaurant afterward, lovely views.

Interesting but overpriced. This is certainly worth a look. Interesting exotic birds, an amazing location, striking building and some art. I would have liked to read more at the museum of Antonio Blanco's story. It took about an hour to have a leisurely look at and I thought the 80000rupiah entrance fee a little expensive.

Monument to and studio of eccentric artist. Worth a visit if you are in Ubud for more than one day. The view from the roof of the museum (of all Ubud) is worth the price of admission, but do enjoy the gardens, the museum (figurative art by Antonio Blanco), and ...my favorite... his studio. It appears to have just been momentarily left by the artist for a break. But he's been gone for some years. An amazing monument to himself. Nice if slightly pricey restaurant on the grounds.

Ok art gallery. While not a 'must see' this gallery is located in beautiful grounds and is ok in terms of value. The artwork is interesting but definitely not to everybody's taste. The exotic birds were probably the highlight for me!

Huge grounds. Very impressive grounds, beautifully maintained. I hadn't heard of him previously, was interested to see some of the paintings, there wasn't enough variety for my taste. The complimentary drink on the terrace was a lovely thought & refreshing after the steep climb up the hill to get to the museum
nice little museum. smallish nice museum, I would't say that its a must see, but if you are bored during a day it is worth visiting, plus the cafe is nice so you can combine food with art:)

Great 'Eve' Arts. Once I was kinda doubting myself by visiting this place. But after I walked in and saw the gallery, I was kinda speechless. The place is big, the staffs are nice and humble. They can serve us and let us know the knowledge about those arts. All pictures are made with Eve subject which is Antonio's wife herself. The place is worth for get some rest and enjoy the gallery.
Beautiful and interesting.. Very beautiful place to have a look around.Our son loved the birds :) Definitely worth visiting while in Ubud.

Not much fun. The guy simply used these people for his own pleasures, the pictures show him to be a pervert at large. Sad that he is renowned for his near porn art. His political artwork and non nude works have potential.

Great Museum. This Museum has friendly staffs , great environment. View From the restaurant is great.Foods at the rondji resaturant are great . Great paintings of course . This museum also has small bu betautiful collection oof birds. Enough said , don't forget to visit this museum whenever you are in ubud! (hahaha)

Well worth a visit!. I just love this place - full of fun eccentricity and wild creativity with a wonderful back story. Read about Don Antonio Bianco before you go - he arrived in Ubud in 1952 and married a very beautiful Balinese dancer. I will let you find out the rest!His art is mainly focused on the female form with a Dali-like influence at times - not really a place for children - though the grounds are amazing and so is the collection of (live) birds that you will see as you enter the garden - enjoy!
Appreciate art. Paintings there are interesting and beautiful.. with green garden and various birds on the garden. Worth to visit of you tired of shopping or sun bath..

Artistic. Entrance fee IDR 30000 for domestic and 50000 for foreigner.A very interesting museum, or let's call it gallery. You can see a lot of Blanco's paints.Many rare birds here, fun to see.If you want to eat there's a restaurant.

A different kind of art gallery. We stumbled on this place by accident as it backed on to our hotel. Starting at the restaurant for lunch which was lovely. the setting is gorgeous and the views spectacular up to Campuhan Walk. There was a bit of a mix up with our order (lost in translation) our banana dessert became a baguette with butter!! however the manager was just so apologetic about the error & our waistlines are better off for it (as we didn't eat the baguette..) We enjoyed our food.pay 50 000 rp to enter the grounds & wander around. the gallery has a renaissance feel about it & the staircase is spectacular. there are exotic parrots such as macaws and toucans, as you enter and you can have your photo taken with them perched on your shoulder (no charge). the place has an eccentric feel about it - it is peaceful, well kept and worth a look. We were there for over 2 hours and I am not an art gallery type person.

Excellent Atmosphere. Nice atmosphere and lighting, looks like victorian castle.
Nice painting arrangement. But no photograph allowed.

Curiously Great. Brilliant. You need to go and experience it for yourselves to get some real feeling about the artist and his surroundings. Great little spot for a cold drink up on the Terrace once you are done.
Fun place. For a couple of hours of fun, this is the place to go, if you like Antonio Blanco's style, which I do. Restaurant is not so great though. Better places close by.

Exotica. Amazing grounds and beautiful exotic birds. They are tame and the keeper will place them on your arm for photos. There is no charge for this apart from the entry fee of 50,000.00 rupee. The interior of the museum is beautiful. You can almost feel the artists presence. The art work is magnificent but unfortunately his nude works have been defaced. They have sprayed a substance on the glass to cover some of the detail. I have never seen this done anywhere else. Art is art. A great restaurant at the top with beautiful views is worth a visit. Very friendly staff and the menu has a good range of food. Half the menu is Spanish food and the other Indonesia.
A unique experience. Amazing building and artwork, lovely meal at restaurant, great Legong dancing show, very high quality in beautiful setting, fun audience oarticipation.

Antonio never let reality get in the way of his dream. See how the other half live, at the home of the famous artist which hosted such names as Mick Jagger and Michael Jackson.While at the Blanco Museum also visit the Ranji Restaurant for an evening meal, where you can take in good food, legong dancing and a spectacular view........the restaurant will also provide a free shuttle service to and from your hotel. Prices are also quite reasonable.
Amazing art works. Well worth a visit, interesting artwork with guide to explain his works, on entrance photos with exotic birds, amazing

Fascinating artist's house and gallery, with grounds and restaurant. My husband and I enjoyed our visit very much although the paintings were not to our taste, we still admired them and their unusual bespoke frames. The gallery is in an extraordinary and eccentric building designed by Don Blanco and completed after his death. His studio was very interesting to see, just as though he had stepped out for a short break. The thing we most enjoyed were the grounds and the wonderful restaurant high up looking over Ubud. You really feel as though you are in the treetops looking down. We didn't have time for a meal, but we enjoyed our complimentary iced drinks and came back to admire the view and have more drinks before leaving. The newish manager was most welcoming and professional, he speaks good English and told us of his plans for this underused facility. I recommend it highly for its location, spacious facilities, stylish furniture and friendly atmosphere.

Not my cup of tea. The art wasn't my taste. All topless Woman. I found the price high, they have some birds to get pictures with. The place seemed odd to me,but if you are a fan of the artist you might enjoy it.

Dali of Bali. Must have) beautiful home, garden with birds, and of course art!)) the place with heard and love! Very recommended! Красивый дом, сад с птицами, и конечно же творчество! Место в котором чувствуется сердце и любовь! Очень талантливый художник и красивая семья. Провели несколько часов в доме, саду, также предлагают напиток от ресторана на территории.

Art does not make up for the blatant misuse of animals in confined spaces. Poor beautiful birds being mistreated, small cages, no perches, drinking water filthy and expected to perform at the drop of a hat. The art is well done, however smutty in its content which also shows the advantage taken by this eccentric artist in Bali so it doesn't surprise me that birds are of the lesser... Go to Neka instead, at least here it is more about the Bali culture and the Art and there is no cruelty to animals evident... My advice, boycott Blanco, it just ain't worth it...

Phenomenal museum experience, not to be missed!. Very unusual experience for Bali. Walk around the grounds outside, for a unique bird collection, visit the museum and head to the roof for sweet views of the city, and have a lovely snack at the restaurant afterwards.Loved the art!

Pleasantly surprised. Blanco Museum not only offer collection from Antonio Blanco but also a glance into his livelihood which surrounded with beautiful Balinese culture, architecture, spiritual and also it's flora and fauna.

Lots of lady bits. I'm not at all artistically inclined, but there were far too many nude paintings for my taste. The grounds themselves were beautiful though. If you are into art it is definitely worth a look.

This places was excellent. So many paint of nude womans and i think it was very funny and the picture was great and have their own story....The place was great and many spot was good for take the photo,,There are some birds and you may take pictures with theme for free...

Unusual art museum. We visited this museum last weekend. It is entirely devoted to the work of Don Antonio Blanco, a Spaniard who moved to Bali in 1952 and married a Balinese dancer, Ni Rondji. His style is described as expressionist- romantic- most of his paintings suggest a fixation with the female breast. The frames for his paintings are unique- unlike anything I've seen elsewhere in the world. The surrounding grounds complete the fantasy theme. A very unusual place!

A must-see - what a character!. This was like stepping into another world...would have loved to have met Mr Blanco himself, must have been a colourful character! Whilst his paintings may be a bit confronting for some, the whole grounds and buildings are a work of art in their own right. Must see.

love this place. I took my two grown up children there this time and almost had the place to ourselves which was wonderful. I have been here once before but this time I saw and read things I had missed previously.
Beautiful grounds. Well worth a visit - lots to see - the beautiful gardens with exotic birds and of course the erotic art in the museum.
Fun. A museum dedicated to a man's ego but the paintings are good and the grounds well worth the visit. Restaurant is not so good but there are others nearby,

a giant and long dragon, creepy yet beautiful. i add that title of my review, because it's true.. two statue of giant and long dragon in front of blanco museum, it;s creepy. you should try inside when no one there. it's noon 12 clock, me and my sis turn back and i remember said 'we should get back, it's cold, creepy and no one is in here'another museum(the front one), it's full of people, chat, watching blanco movie.. the one i talked about it;s in the back, near private area.. loli guess i just my opinion (in a good way), so you should come here travelers. lots of painting of antonio blanco and many art statue in here.

A colourful sanctuary. Don Antonio's lair in Ubud is a nice place to visit, especially for art lovers. Entrance Fee is IDR 35 K (USD 3.5) , and you will be greeted by a bunch of parrots, nice enough to climb your hand and shoulders. The Garden is beautiful and peacefull, the Gate to the Gallery is majestuous. Too bad you cannot take picture inside the gallery as to capture the artworks of the Maestro.

Peaceful location. This museum show antonio blanco and mario blanco painting. The artwork itself quite interesting but not really suitable for children. There are an entrance fee for the museum, it's about IDR 30,000 for locals and IDR 50,000 for tourist.There are also a guide which is really kind and explain most of the artwork for us. You can't take picture inside the museum and studio but you can take picture on the rooftop of the museum which shown ubud's scenery, on the garden with their bird collection, at the shop which you can act like an artist, and at the restaurant.I really love the restaurant because it's really peaceful and comfy.We're been directed to this place after our museum tour and we're given some drink maybe created from a local ingredients while enjoying the scenery from the open air restaurant. If i bring a book, maybe i can spend 2-3 hour there..
Interesting works. Interesting works, especially how the frames were designed to compliment the paintings. The entrance fees (Rp50000) is quite pricy though.

Nice Art, Brutal Animal Treatment. Until this museum eliminates the clipped-wing parrots and tiny cages jammed with other birds all over the grounds, it is not up to a standard any self-respecting tourist should want to patronize. Parrot in the first photo screeched in frustration when I was there, weaving its body in flight simulation and flapping useless clipped wings. Imagine being forced to grip a branch the rest of your life when your body is made for flying. One parrot hung from cage ceiling to relieve its feet (see photo). Birds normally have the entire sky as their habitat - now confined to 2 ft square space. They flap like mad (see photo) until they give up and stand there the rest of their pathetic lives. This cheesy approach to captivate tourists should be gone the way of the petting zoo and dodo bird. If your art is good enough, why should you have to sacrifice birds to attract tourists? Write a review like this if you agree. Maybe they will stop. (Photos are only a sample - there are numerous caged birds on site.)
The Dali from Bali. Very strange, but special atmosphere! All paintings and artwork is exposés in a kind of palace. Serenity, and almost not reality.

exceptional artist like Dalí. although it seems a copy of Dalí, Antonio Blanco managed to create a special art style wich he integrated into a complete presentation. The location offers good views too

Dalli of Bali. Impressive museum of Don Antonio' s dream realised! Is a must for art lovers. Set on a 2ha estate in a relaxed garden complex. Also his son Mario Blanco is very talented painter.Exhibition is a must.

Beautiful Building. I'm not a big fan of Blanco's art (who seemed like a bit of a letch and liked to compare himself to Dali) though the building itself is worth the visit. Be sure to get up to the roof for one of the best views of Ubud.

Interesting. We just happened to stumble across the The Blanco Renaissance Museum while out walking one day and decided to take a look. There is an entrance fee ($50,000 Rp - approx. $5.00 Cdn) which also included a refreshing welcome drink in the restaurant. The restaurant has spectacular views from high on the hill. We arrived early in the morning just as it was opening, so there were no crowds and it was very relaxing to stroll around the beautiful grounds and also be able to take our time while walking through the art museum. There are the most beautiful captivating birds on display (live birds) that are wonderful for pictures. I actually think I liked the birds the best!Staff within the museum are very happy to talk about Don Antonio Blanco's life and history. Sounds like he was quite the character in his day! The museum itself is grandeur with winding staircases and art displayed on every wall.It is worth the small entrance fee that is charged.

Don't go there if you are not interested with art. The painting is so amazing, but will be a bit boring for those who's not realy into art. But it's fine because it's not realy expensive to get in. And you will get a cup of tea (it's more like lemongrass tea) which is realy good, and the view from the restaurant is awesome !

Those birds!. They really have these interesting birds. Soo cute and funny until it was quite hard for me to decide which I love the most: their beautiful parrots, the amazing Don Antonio Blanco's life, his works or just all of them at once :)

Worth a stop if you're down that way. Not knowing much about Antonio Blanco I stopped in after hiking the Campuan Ridge. Entrance was 50k rp which included a nice welcome drink at the restaurant on site. The waiter was kind enough to provide me the wifi password so I was able to sit and recover a bit from the hike. The grounds are beautiful and the house is well taken care of. It was very interesting to learn about this painter and his impact on Ubud and vice versa. Mr. Blanco was highly inspired by the woman who would walk around bare chested with stuff balanced on their heads and it reflects in his subject matters.Definitely would recommend for a stop by to see the Dali-esque nudes and other drawings. If you have children in tow, you will want to make an educated decision about bringing them depending on your own personal beliefs regarding nudity as there is no way to avoid it.
Interesting Art!. Antonio Blanco Muesum is a must see for all Art Lovers staying in Ubud. Research about the history to get deeper into the history of Balinese Culture!

A must see in ubud. This museum was a very surprising find. Antonio Blanco was a contemporary of Dali but his style and subjects are very different. Most of his oeuvre on display here are portraits of Balinese dancers. His brushwork is very loose with thin glazes of oil paint and this produces really beautiful elegant impressionistic paintings. They are truly delightful and well worth a visit. The free drink is iced coffee, OK if you rare American, bit otherwise skip it!

An artist Dream. The whole creative ephemeral experience was memorable - the gardens birds restaurant added to the ambience - definitely a must see for any one who appreciates creativity - Inspirational!

Insight into eclectic artist. Crazy house, crazy frames, crazy collages at the end. Art is eccentric - earlier Balinese women works are of interest but it's the insight into the "Dali of Bali" as he was known that is intriguing.

Big Piece of Art. I rarely go to art museum or gallery, but this one is very enjoyable. Their paintings are full of soul, sometimes you can't understand what's inside it but surely you can feel them. Even the museum's building is a piece of art. Nice place.

A waste of time, unfortunately. The entry was fine, and my wife and i were looking forward to experience, however we came away very disappointed on two fronts. I know that art is in the eye of the beholder, however we found his artwork to be repetitive and boring, and some items quite smutty, admittedly there were a couple of portraits of family that did show his artistic ability. More offensive however was the state of the bird enclosures out the back. Some birds had no perches (they sticks had fallen to the bottom of the cage), after about an hour of talking to staff they eventually took some action to put some perches in. It was a very distressing experience.

Museum surprise in Ubud!. On a rainy day we decided to visit this museum and we were not disappointed! When you enter the museum you have a beautiful garden full with exotic birds flying around. The actual building is also very impressive. The paintings were ofcourse very nice too! There is also a nice restaurant where they offer good food/ cocktails and wines. (only the staff can work on their kindness here)
Fun place. Just over the Campuhan bridge a fun gallery of paintings by one expat artist. Nice garden. Pleasant way to spend a couple of hours.

Blanco's Monument to His Ego. When Blanco was alive, the artist liked to have a servant strike a gong to let him know visitors were arriving. Then you could go up and fawn all over him while he held court. After his death he built a museum in his own honor as big as the Taj Majal. His "art" is mostly paintings of women's genitals, if you like that sort of thing. The building, though tasteless, is pretty spectacular. It exceeds the art works it houses in splendor.

Really talented artist; somewhat limited in subject range. Beautiful setting - a mansion with pretty grounds and lots of domesticated tropical birds swooping in the trees overhead. Antonio Blanco was obviously a very talented artist but his obsession with female body parts becomes a little tedious as you go through the upper floors and the sketches become more "detailed". Wish he had visually described more of his world.
overrated. it is overrated. there are tons of things to do in ubud culturally. if you finished all of them, you can try this place otherwise it is not significant art there.

Beautiful. One of the best museums in Bali. I like art very much and I thoroughly enjoyed gazing at the dreamy portraits. Blanco is magnificent in his almost impressionist approach to female nudes. The museum is made to look like a European mansion and it actually feels like it with the gorgeous frames, luxurious sofas and chairs, and piped-in operatic vocals. You don't feel like you're in a gallery.The museum is the kind where you are not overloaded with images. It allows you to enjoy them as much as you enjoy the surroundings.Highly recommended.
Lovely restaurant on site. Best for those who appreciate art. The grounds surrounding the gallery is quite small but lovely. The restaurant is on a hill overlooking jungle ravines.
simply wonderful. The building itself is art. Love the style of mister Blanco, his paitings are truly amazing. The gardens are well kept and the restaurant is a nice place to relax afterwards.

Animal cruelty. It is very disappointing that at the rear of the museum that runs along penestanan road there is an aviary of exotic parrots. These birds are in constant distress according the intense shrieking. It is not necessary and incredibly disappointing.

Great museum. Exhibits are mostly oil paintings. I enjoyed the short movie about the artist and his wife. Beautiful garden to walk around. Saw several very beautiful and unusual birds by the museum entrance.

Fascinating. Very unusual artist with a great talent. Exquisite frames on the paintings which are hung in a very grand gallery. Some of the paintings are a little lascivious in some regards which is a shame because it does not seem to add to the exhibition. Birds on entrance are fascinating.

Mind blowing paintings. I am not a museum kind of person, but was told not to give this museum a miss. I understood why once I entered the place. Paintings are interesting and mind blowing. Difficult to explain. I especially like the unique frames. The ladies attending to my family and me were knowledgeable and polite. The free drink of iced coffee was a real treat.
artistic. he was a nut man, this Blanco! A lot of naked woman, a lot of fun (like Salvador Dali) and his frames were beautiful!
Friendly service. I don't know anything about painting and art but they has nice architecture and friendly services to customer
Fun day out. Just over the bridge at Campuan the museeum is devoted to just one aritist who lived in the latter half of the last century in Ubud. Excellent way to spend a couple of hours.
Watch and learn . You will learn a lot about Balinese women in this museum. It has great paintings. The park around the museum is nice as well.
Fun place. Great collection devoted just to one man (and his son). Wildly erotic, humorous oil paintings - about 200 - in a free style. Lovely garden.

Amazing!. One of the most impressive museums I've ever visited! The museum itself isn't big but it's beautiful inside out...the location is also pretty amazing.The paintings are really chef-d'oeuvres...hard to describe...but Blanco not only painted but also created unique space between a picture and a frame making the whole thing look like a collage.The museum territory also includes a restautant and a small bird garden.

Well worth a visit even if your not into art.. Great presentation of his artwork and just as impressive is the framing which was also designed by him.then at the end to sit with an iced coffee (which is included in the entry fee) and take in the view of the valley .

Amazing artwork.... Visited the museum this morning and after you catch your breathe from the steep walk up.... You then have to catch your breathe for the amazing view over the hilltops of Ubud. The gardens are just beautiful to walk around. There are some amazing tame maccaws and other birds that you can get your photo taken with. And at no extra cost to the entrance fee, which is a rarity! The artwork of Don Antonia Blanco is something else. I won't describe it in detail, but suffice to say I felt like I was in a museum in either Spain or Italy. So ornate, so eclectic and that is just the frames of the artwork!His son who also is an artist is amazing as well, yet totally different styles. And then you walk into the actual studio where Don Antonio used to paint and his son still uses the studio, is such a privilege. Its quite an experience to sit where both artists were inspired to create such magnificent pieces.Well worth a visit for art lovers. And for those that aren't its a great visit to a beautiful location that although is so Bali...... It is so not Bali as well.

Fun afternoon. I'm not a big fan of art so I'm not quite sure if there are surrealist collection but it was fun to see and read each of it. Enjoy the paintings in the big house with great decoration, then go outside to the garden to play with the birds, and maybe take some photos with them. The entrance fee includes free ice coffee at the nice garden cafe. Oh, and try to go to the rooftop and get some nice Ubud view :)

What an Artist!. Interesting to see into the mind of an obsessive artist, he does have a passion for Women. The grounds of this museum and the exotic birds and orchids are also stunning, set on a hill overlooking Ubud.

Overrated painter. The building itself is quite pleasant and eccentric and reminds a bit of Dali. Blanco is in fact often compared with him but his paintings no longer stand the comparison with the famous spanish painter. They are repetitive and shallow and do not revolutionize art in any way. Really disappointing.

A must visit in Ubud. It is just 5 min walk from the city center, Entrance fee 50,000Rp, the museum close at 5 pm, there is a video show a must see gives you how life was in Bali 50/60 years ago, he liked women and painted them well and what a building and the grand entrance hall!

A nice museum. It's nice enough if you have a couple of hours free in Ubud. A number of interesting artworks, and a tour of his studio. There's also Rondji Restaurant nearby if you want to stop for lunch afterwards.
Great stuff.. Really, really enjoyed this place. Blanco was obviously quite out there and enjoyed his paintings and the birds everywhere as well. Free drink at the bar was a nice touch too.

this gets excellent because if you are anyway artistically inclined you will be amused, horrified in disbelief at this.. its bonkers, architecturally. Narsassistic as an artist. Remarkably in its existance. there is art, love, pain and death... yea well what do you expect?

Don't miss this. It's a must see in Ubud. Top notch art, Antonio Blanco's art brings together the feel of Gauguin and adds a unique Balinese flavor. His family still continues the tradition of painting. Don't miss out on his life story. The the museum is set on a hilltop with stunning views of Ubud, surrounding hills, the river Campuan well blow in a picturesque gorge. The park like grounds alone are well worth the trip. It also has a top notch restaurant Rondji's. A free drink is includes in the entrance fee. My only regret is that I discovered it late into my Balinese adventure. Would have eaten there many times. Or maybe just enjoyed a peaceful drink and the scenery.

Classic. Worth to visit if you are in Ubud Area. It's classic! The paintings are fabulous! And don't forget to ask the staffs about Don Antonio Blanco's story. They have a nice restaurant as well, but I forgot the name of the restaurant.

Interesting Museum with top rate restaurant.. Bianco Museum nw has a fabulous upmarket restaurant at the top looking over the river gorge ,the Campuan bridge back towards Ubud. The fusion food is superb,the service top rate and the atmosphere excellent. Sevaral nights a week they have traditional Balinese dancers and a very good Gamalan group. Apart from the collection of art of Blanco,the grounds and architecture are fabulous with a collection of exotic birds .Plus a breeding program of the endangered Bali Starling.. Lovely jewellery in the small shop and plenty of prints and posters of the masters works.

Fantasy and Art. : Don Antonio Blanco Museum is a must as it brings back the feeling of Gaugin in French Polynesia. Blanco was a Philippine/Spanish Artist in the mid-20th Century and was married to a Balinese. His son Mario continues the tradition of painting. You will be enchanted with the garden and the colorful parrots and cockatiels.

Dali of Bali. An absolutely lovely setting on a hill overlooking Ubud. The gardens are spacious and the house and surrounding sculptures quirky. I like the paintings much more than I had expected to. The welcome drinks are a nice touch, and the staff is very friendly. Well worth an hour of your time.

Bali's Dali fabulously mad. The self-declared Dali of Bali, Don Antonio built an amazing house to house his somewhat average artistic output. You arrive to a parrot handler offering you macaws and parrots (on your arm or head for photos if you wish) and the gardens and building are incredible. Climb to the roof of the main gallery for an unforgetable view back down on Ubud. Entrance includes a drink of the day (we had iced caramel) in the French themed restaurant, perfect before the walk back to Ubud.

Quirky paintings. Happily whiled away a couple of hours here. I loved his paintings (it's worth reading the text on all of them. I think it's fair to say he LIKED women!)I enjoyed wandering around the garden too. There are about ten tame birds (cockatoos, macaws, etc) plus others including Bali starlings in cages. The admission ticket includes a welcome drink in the cafe, which overlooks the river gorge.
Fun. Exceellent art gallery set up by an ego maniac, but he could paint wonderfully .You can happily spend a couple of houtrs there.

Little piece of Europe in the tropics. This was on our must see list and it didn't disappoint. Beautiful gardens and building. Some beautiful artworks, although the one's on the way out near Antonio's study weren't to my taste. The view from the roof top was lovely. We had our welcome drink in the lovely cafe afterwards. Definately worth a visit for any lover of art and history.
Creepy. A lovely view from where this is located, but seriously bad art. Odd collages scattered about the gaudy house.

Definitely not my style. While the building that houses the galery is stunning, the artwork itself is not my cup of tea at all. Most of the paintings were of naked women, and weren't particularly good. We paid our entrance fee and were there for about 10 minutes tops.

One of the must-sees of a trip to Ubud. Camp lovers, lend me your ear! You will LOVE "The Dali of Bali". The guy was an excellent painter, too. The garden and grounds are to die for- BRING YOUR CAMERA! You will want to pose in these settings!

Dali di Bali. not want to comment too much...about this place.Go...and see with your eyes. Please..don't miss here.if you come to Ubud it's Faboulous in and outside.n café&restaurant here simply delicious !
great paintings. fascinating setting with selection of great paintings. well worth a visit. Great views over the valley. Authentic settings of the painter are well retained

boobs and birds. Almost all painting are naked woman, at least half naked. One of them is a provocative paint, shows a woman on top of bigben. Blanco also kind a fan of exotic bird. From maleo, kakatua raja to macaw from south america.
The marble in front of the museum is marvelous. Not too many attractions there.
nice experience. visit the museum with my wife, this antonio blanco is women lover. a lot of his painting is topless women and most of them is his own wife.
Unique - not your average Gallery. I visit this museum every time I visit Bali & never tire of it. The venue is beautiful & they provide the services of a free guide.

Not my cuppa tea. Eccentric and most of the paintings are of boobs and naked ladies...some would like this type of art some don't....it's definitely not mine. Not much of an introduction when to go in there. At least have someone at the front to give a short intro...we already paid the entrance so at least give something back. We are allowed to roam around and that it is.
antonios paintings. the guide,humourous good knowledge of the artist,the erotica room,the gardens,the birds,the location,great restaurant on site.

unusual painting. unusual art, beautiful grounds of the museum with many birds of different species of parrots. Visit the artist's studio, watch a film about his life and read a biography of the journal in the room next to the studio. Learn about the importance of traditional Balinese dance and see the beauty of its performers in the paintings of the artist.
A true palace. Had a great time with the birds (how can that be? go and see!), beautiful garden, works of art in an impressive palace of a house. Highly recommended!

Very fine paintings. I didn't know about Don Antonio Blanco before arriving here. It appears he was a major talent and I enjoyed seeing his work. Don't know why photographs aren't allowed. Can it possibly damage his art? Or are they just afraid it will reduce sales from the museum gift shop?Grounds are well kept and the house itself is flamboyant. Coming here was a good experience. Also enjoyed seeing the parrots.
when Asian meets Europeans... Really nice and beautiful art combination of Asian and Europeans style. But really great place. They even have parrots which you could take picture with and free drinks
Interesting Collection. Certainly worth a visit for the art and architecture. I advise against letting the birds perch on your shoulder though as one of them bit me and drew blood.

Worth a visit but not a special trip. Needs a more full and expanatory history and overview of Blanco's life and work for the curious. Either a chronology of, or perhaps period groupings of, the paintings, would be helpful.
Very interesting place in Ubud. Highly recommended art museum place in Ubud. Antonio Blanco was an eccentric artist that found home in Ubud. Beautiful paintings collection set in a arty palace.

Fascinating peek into an intriguing artist's home. Loved this place for the sheer eccentricity of it. Greeted by a menagerie of parrots and chickens out the front, climbed to the rooftop to find the precariously balanced golden statues, cool and magestic marble interior and of course lots of artwork - from Dali-esque to Renaissance-esque (by the way, I'm not an art expert!! - different styles though). You get to see his studio too. The 50,000 rupiah ticket includes a free drink in the restaurant next door - bargain.

A gorgeous museum for it's art and the marble building it's housed in. We had been here 18 years ago and saw Antonio Blanco's work displayed in his home and studio . At that time , his wife showed us around and talked about his work ,including that she had served as one of his models .The artwork is now displayed in a two story marble museum that is part of a compound including the families home , studio and gallery and the Blanco family's temple with a huge 50 year old Banyan tree and Hindu pagoda.Don Antonio's artwork focuses on his adoration of women in a expressionist-romantic style . The frames are gorgeous as well with Balinese carved wood .There is also a beautiful restaurant with stunning views and the river flowing beneath it .

An eccentic and erotic artist. We loved this muesum. Antonio Blanco was a very erotic and eccentric artist whose main subjects were woman. I wish we had longer to spend here but I did purchase a copy of his book which is very detailed and has even more erotic text. A must visit for any art enthusiast.

Best museum in ubud. Just outside the center of ubud is the esentric and unique blanco museum. Very reminiscent of Dali but still very different. This is by far my favorite museum in ubud and totally worth the visit.

Unique with lots of nudity. I am not sure what the general female visitors would think but I enjoyed most of the paintings. Lots of nudity but they are not vulgar. I brought my young sons and they seemed quite embarrassed with many of the paintings.

Nice museum, garden history.. They do not allow photograph in the museum but it's ok outside... not much to see, Paintings, canvas. I am not a painting or artist expert aficionado but still enjoyed the display gallery. The architecture itself (Banco house) is already amazing by itself.. Yeah. It wasn't a wow to me because I'm no art lover, but never the less the time and entry fee was not regrettable. Like history? and you'd love the story it tells. Friendly staff, nice restaurant outside, pricey but you get what you pay. Nice serene surrounding. The place located quite high, so you get a nice green view at teh restaurant.

Wow at every turn!. Beautiful museum and grounds. Blanco was an artist unknown to my wife and I and his portraits, nudes and still life were beautiful, playful and thought provoking! Definitely go and spend an hour or two.

I love museums!. I appreciate this place not only for the paintings that I saw on the main two storey building and the old building too, but also for the architecture of the museum and the whole place! I can feel how much Don Antonio enjoyed his life with his beloved wife, a Balinese dancer, and how much he loved his life as a painter, father, husband and human being. He done a lot in introduce Bali and Balinese art to the world, every his exhibition he took his wife along and she would do the performance of Balinese dance on her husband's painting exhibition. Firstly, after we pay the entrance tickets we walk thru a narrow pathway up to the old building that before was a home of Antonio Blanco family. Then we turn to the left and welcomed by birds that are sitting on the artificial tree limb. Sometimes we can pick up our welcome drinks from the table in the garden in the front of the entrance to the Museum, or sometimes the staff will give it to us there. I love to enjoy their tranquil garden before we went home.I can close my eyes and feel the spirit in this place ...

Palace of The Maestro. valuable experience to see the way of life of the maestro and masterpiece paintings. History, culture and family life of Don Antonio Blanco. One of the historical heritage of the greatness of love Bali culture. Dominance of paintings about women because he loves and respects his mother. Great story behind every painting! Must visit!

The Dali of Bali. This is a truly eccentric place. Upon arrival the exotic birds are adorning you and the extravagant flowers are bursts of colour amongst the trees. The artworks are particularly strong in their links to erotic Surrealism but the interest in this place is really the atmosphere which the eccentric building has on you. Make sure you get up onto the roof via the spiral staircase on the landings from the second floor of the gallery.

Different and Somewhat Unique; worth a visit if you're into art. The gardens surrounding the place are nice and there are a bunch of different birds flapping around on the grass and in cages located around the gardens. A walk through the museum shows you the extravagance of Antonio Blanco. Overall, I have to say it did not click with me. The man obviously was very talented, but his paintings are mostly all nude women in various poses with water bottles and other trinkets scattered around. The frames of the paintings are also quite tacky. Once you've seen one painting of his you've seen them all. It gets boring quickly. It's not to everybody's taste but I guess it's worth to have seen it once at least.

Recommend For Art Lover. We enjoyed the atmosphere, bird in garden, love the art, I would like to stay there maybe for one or two weeks if it is possible ^^. Nice places and recommended for you ART LOVER >.< #Awesome.

Its very educative. I personally like museum, but my husband doesnt. but after looking this museum, he otomatically try to find out the meaning of its painting also want to know about Antonio Blanco personally.Antonio Blanco was very popular in the world of art. Although his paint mostly quite vulgar, but some of his art could make the paint looks like photograph.

Weird but good.. After mixed reviews, we naturally wanted to see for ourselves, plus we were staying in Ani's Villas just opposite. We'd say not to everybody's taste but certainly very interesting and worth a visit. We liked some of the art, not all, but the building and grounds were also interesting, as was the story of Don Antonio.

Weird and Glad. They call Blanco "the Bali Dali." His artworks are a bit weird. The museum used to be his house. The grounds are pretty. And there are many kodak moments with all kinds of beautiful birds on the property. An attendant helps pose the birds for your photos. We were glad we went there, but it was not the "highlight of the day."

Home-Gallery. It's a home-museum. So we can see the Blanco's life better than only "see" him thru his paintings. The bad thing is, there's no one around to explain and assist you while enjoying his art.

Great Views from the restaurant. I was here with my wife last month, although im not really a keen painting enthusiast bu i've had my fair share of visiting museums everywhere.. I think the view from the house is very nive, especially in the reataurant area where you can see the river views while enjoying the delicious sarsaparila drink. The museum is filled with Blanco's fascination on balinese women, what would be great if we can get a storyline of evolution of his styles in the paintings but i didnt see that.You can also see his son's painting collection in the museum...

Lovely setting with mediocre artwork. After just spending time in the Museu-Teatre Salvador Dali in Spain, I realized how short Blanco fell in his attempt to imitate Dali. The grounds and gallery building are worth seeing and there are some wonderfully colourful birds by the entrance. Blanco's art is at times mildly pornographic but he certaily celebrated the beauty of Balinese women. Much was just fair art but some pieces were well done. His frames are quite fascinating as they are very definitely a created part of the paintings. The humidity of Bali is not being kind to some of the pieces and components and there appears to be serious deterioration to some works. Overall the art I did not find that great but it is a pleasant place to spend an hour. There is an attached restaurant that overlooks the Campuan River. For all his eccentricities he certainly is not a Dali.

3rd rate artist in tacky museum setting. Not sure what is funnier, the art that Blanco painted, or the fact that he considered himself equal to the likes of Dali. Maybe he believed his own PR, or maybe Bali had not seen an excentric, womanizing European painters before? The repetative, boring still lifes and portriats indicate his basic training, but he never gained more than a mildly talented art school student.The location itself in Ubud is ideal, with beautiful views nearby, but you can skip this if you are looking for nteresting art.

Spanish art in Bali. After walking More or less 8 km n the sun I reached the museum. It was a very hot day, the sun was killing, I reached the Don Antonio Blanco Museum. Before going to Bali I as visiting Valencia in Spain and it was very surprising to go to the Blanco Museum whose painter came from Valencia, Spain. Mr. Antonio Blanco has travelled the world before settling down i n Bali. I enjoyed his paintings very much. Some of the paintings are somewhat Dali-ish. family is still living n the premises and his son in his footsteps. I could even go into his work painting place.The museum is situated on a hill top, where you can enjoy the view sipping at a welcome drink at the restaurant.

Semi Dali and many many bare boobs. I visited this museum on my own and real early in the morning, so I had the place to myself. Almost all the paintings Don Blanco made are in celebration of the beauty of the Balinese woman. Some are a bit pornographic but in general it's a very pleasant hour to spend, not in the least because the museum and the grounds around it are incredibly beautiful.

What a Feast to the Eyes!. My guide didn't give away the contents of this museum except that it's not the ordinary kind of museum and that i would find it interesting. Well, i trusted him and have no regret at all. The museum itself is sitting in a 2 hectares compound and come with a serene restaurant up on the hill - Rondji Restaurant! Served great food!
Classy. Amazing artwork! You get a chance to sit in Antonio's studio! They sell reproductions and post card type prints. Mae sure you visit the restaurant afterwards, amazing service.

Great House of Art. Indulge yourself with beautiful impressionist artworks. There was this 1 staff, Wayan, that was so kindly guided us throughout the museum. The maestro himself is a truly sex-driven artist and you can see his love to his wife through his works. Nice museum.

Impressive location. We went there early in the morning, no many people around. Free non-alcoholic drink is included in the ticket price so after a walk around the museum you can sit and relax under the shade. Another must see for everyone in Ubud.

Loved every second of this weird and wonderful place!. I'd heard a lot about this place and it was the only museum that we chose to visit during our stay in Bali...I'm so glad we did! The gardens were beautiful, the birds exquisite and colourful, the art work and frames were spellbinding and the building which housed Blancos masterpieces was jaw dropping. I thoroughly enjoyed walking the grounds and viewing his unique works in their beautiful museum setting. He was a quirky character with an interesting life story that I would like to learn more of. Its no wonder he fell in love with Ubud and the Balinese people. I also loved viewing his actual studio which remains much the same as it did when he was working in it. I wanted to purchase the book of his works and story but found $100 AUD a little expensive. Will just have to google more on him! I bet a movie made on his life would be an interesting one. Yes he was a bit of a perv, and some of his work is a bit OUT there and for adults only, but all in all a very interesting way to while away a couple of hours - don't forget the restaurant for refreshments on your way out - beautiful views of the Ubud valley and gorgeous food - great for lunch or an afternoon dessert.

totally over the top!. flamboyance at its best-- there’s really nothing like it. you must go! Amazing erotic art, architecture, exotic gardens full of tropical birds, beautiful women offering complimentary iced tea with, of course, a little flower in it. A great date-- or just go on your own! A must see.
Worth Visiting. Like the fact that a Spanish artist stumbled upon Ubud and Bali and ended living there all his life. Superb art pieces in the museum.
loved this museum. well worth a visit loved it ... loved it... and i bought 6 photo's to frame when i get home beautiful paintings and exotic birds you can hold

Fabulous Frames. I've been to Ubud many times and thought I'd seen all of the best attractions. Not so! The Blanco Gallery / Museum is fabulous! A grand building to be sure and interesting paintings all set in very original frames. OK Don Antonio was abit of a perv. and some of his works are not for the feint of heart (or prudish) but you have to give hime full marks for presentation and the building and grounds are nothing short of fabulous. But that's not all - the birds... the birds are fabulous. Most caged but many free to fly there is a wonderful collection of tropical birds here. Yes it will ost you 50K but I assure you an attraction like this would cost 4 or 5 time that elsewhere. Go ahead spend a couple hours at Dons place. You'll love it.
Marvellous insight. into the way Bali was some years ago and the wonderful mind and concepts created by the artist and the manner in which he lived with his Balinese wife and children.
beautiful building. worth a visit to see the amazing building but the artwork was average. Blanco seems to be Bali's answer to Norman Lindsay....female breasts in every painting

Unusual but not art that I can appreciate. Antonio Blanco Museum has become quite an institution in Ubud. The ground is huge and beautifully kept and the artchitecture and interiors of the mansion where the art works are held are already worth the ticket. The wild and rather abstract painting of Blanco is centred on one main theme: sex and sexuality. Nudity there are plenty but also more explicit subjects that could make the prudish blush. Maybe the museum should be rated 18 SX. There's also a section dedicated to his son Mario which works I can appreciate more.

Over-priced tickets. So Blanco seemed to be obsessed with Balinese women and their breasts! His artwork is all very interesting, and the compound in which the museum stands is also very beautiful, but Rp. 50,000 for an entry ticket (even though you get a complimentary drink) is too high.

Something Different. My cousin and I enjoyed a Look at the life of Antonio Blanco this morning at his Blanco Museum and thoroughly enjoyed it, even managing to meet and talk to the artists sister in law who still lives in the grounds of the museum.This was a bonus and gave us a good insight in to his character and Spanish volatility.Can certainly see why he was known as the Dali of Bali! Quite a few kinky and quirky paintings, but equally as many great portraits of dignitaries and artists from all over the world.Beautiful views from the museum and restaurant overlooking the river and well worth the AUD$5 entry fee.
Beautiful. great way to pass some time in Ubud. Blanco is a very talented artist, it's well worth a visit even to just appreciate the beautiful gardens.

Interesting, but don't bother if you have limited time in Ubud. If you have a few weeks, or happen to catch a rainy day, this isn't a bad place to spend an hour or so. Some of the work is quite good..some if it is off the map into absurd. If you are only in Ubud for a couple of days, there are many better things to spend your time on.
Great museum. Can highly recommend a couple of hours here. Wonderful location with great views and amazing building......and that's not to mention his artwork - which is wonderful!

Fascinating. A must see, but not for your kids.. Amazing artwork, but leave the kids at home! Something you need to prepare for, is that Don Antonio Blanco was a brilliant artist... and an absolute pervert. Might be akward if you go with your parents..!Not only are the actual paintings incredible but take the time to admire the creative FRAMES that he also custom designed for each one. The layout of the place is also superb. Photography is prohibited. Gaurds watch you like a hawk.

Juvenille, self-indulgent nonsense. The Blanco Museum is not worth going to. It's not expensive, so it's not a waste of money, but it is a waste of time. He was known by some as the "Dali of Bali" - but that's a massive insult to Dali. (And to Bali, for that matter.) There is nothing innovative, surrealistic, or thought-provoking of Blanco's work. It's a man who loved women, loved naked women, and loved painting naked women. And he crafted a few really inane collages that seemed like they were made by a teen-aged boy. The museum is his beautiful home and grounds, but really it's not worth paying the entrance fee for just that. You do get a welcome drink, which is nice. So that was probably the highlight.

Antonio Blanco Museum. Having seen a picture of this Museum in the Lonely Planet Pocket Bali we thought it would be interesting to have a look.We are so glad we did, we had never herd of Antonio Blanco his art is truly inspiring and the man himself an inspiration. If you are making the trip to Ubud you should go see this museum not only for the Art but also for the Building.

Beautiful setting. I enjoyed the gardens and architecture as well as the interesting paintings by Antonio Blanco. There is a quiet ambience which I liked. Upstairs is a comfortable cafe where we received a free welcome drink. Nice touch.A pity the stained glass dome at the top of the great building was covered. It would be magnificent with the light pouring through.Highly recommended visit though.

A Very Nice Art Museum. I visited The Blanco Museum back in September 2012. It was a pleasant visit with a perfect ambience for an art museum. The facility was superb for a IDR 50k entrace ticket. I got a free welcome drink that was delicious. Overall the museum is worth visiting but I can't get enough information of the painting, like the story behind it, etc. I hope they can make some improvements on the information media.
A real gem. An art gallery of this quality in a small place like Ubud was a real surprise. The museum garden should be a museum in itself. How did a Catalan painter end up in Ubud, so long ago?
An interesting place!. Some of the paintings are quite revealing. Maybe not advisable to bring children along.. However, this is an impressive place with a lot of interesting pictures.

Good but not for children. This is one of the best privat museum in Indonesia. Blanco's Family has managed this museum very profesional. When you visit Ubud, Bali, Museum The Blanco Renaissance is the comfort destination to understand Balinese girl in the past decadeBlanco captured the beautiful Balinese girl and painted on the canvas. We also visit to his old studio and imagine how Blanco painted with Balinese girl. Many nude picture, so it isn't suitable for children

Good museum with huge collection from the master antonio blanco, you can see also the journey of his life.. Good museum with huge collection from the master antonio blanco, you can see also the journey of his life.
Great adventure in art!. This is a must visit in Ubud. Truly no other artist like El Maestro Blanco. His paintings of Balinese women are personal and hold your interest and gaze.

Rondji restaurant, next to Don Antonio Blanco Museum.... My wife and I went to this restaurant for lunch with friends from Australia (we are from UK) and we had a delicious meal, Beef Wellington with mashed potatoes and vegetables, followed by a tarragon panacotta dessert. Our friends had an Indonesian satay dish which they said was excellent. We then enjoyed coffee on comfortable rattan settees by the balcony overlooking distant paddie fields which were a lovely green colour. Very relaxing. The service was excellent, the staff could not have been more helpful and attendant. I was particularly impressed with the cleanliness of the restaurant's public toilets which has not always been the case with other establishments we have visited during our stay in Bali. A delightful couple of hours. We decided to visit the museum on another day.

Strange place to have in Ubud, but beautiful art!. It is all marble and very European in design, so it felt a bit out of place in Ubud. On the other hand the artwork was beautiful and very well presented. Go onto the balcony and walk around. It is very peaceful.

Blanco Will Be Very Pround With His. This museum was the one of the best museum I ever looked. From the gate until the restaurant, from the yard until the gallery was very beautiful.Actually when you arrive here, the first thing that the museum staff will give you a welcoming drink, after that you going to the Blanco's yard with full of birds (a very beautiful birds) after that to the main gallery with full of pictures (they have two floors in the main gallery). After that you going to the work room (studio) where Blaco painted almost of his pictures.From 1 to 10 scale, I think this museum will get 9!The staffs are very friendship and will explain many things about this museum.Have a nice moment in Blanco museum.

The Dali of Bali. Wow, this was a treasure to visit. A European artist in Bali since the 1950's and his artwork is certainly provocative. Celebrates the female form. Interesting family history and just a beautiful museum to visit. Make the effort to go there.

Quirky and eccentric. A must see even if you're not a big art fan. The resident birds are a sight and the building itself is quite stunning. The 500K entry includes a welcome drink, so hardly expensive. And, Don Blanco's art is certainly an eye opener...

phenomenal 'mad' artist gallery pack in one. the story behind Don Antonio Blanco and his family life is the most interesting part of my visit. I personally understand nothing about paintings and arts. but this museum is just cool. fits for anyone.Don Antonio Blanco designed his own frame along with his painting, so its pack in one theme. everything is so original and well designed.Don Antonio Blanco's son also has his own gallery near his studio.this museum has a special room suitable for kids above 17 y o. displayed sensual arts.you can change your entrance ticket for a welcome drink at Rondji Restaurant.

The best thing about this place is the birds. They have many different kinds of gorgeous exotic birds on the grounds here. They give you a drink on arrival which is nice. The building is impressive and the view from the top is great. However, the art was "old beatnik." Kinda lecherous and not in a sexy way, just pathetic. Lots of artsy fartsy collages and tacky 60s era paintings. If you go, you have got to see the photo of Antonio Blanco with his family. He's flourishing paintbrushes and has the most ridiculous "I'm so full of myself" pose. It's a laugh though I feel sorry for his family.

Not for me. I went with my husband and a friend to see this 'museum and I was highly disappointed. My husband wanted to go as we missed the opportunity last time we were in Ubud, so we made a special trip to it.I don't know why people complain about costs here in Ubud...50,000rp to get in? Big deal, it's only $5 bucks out of my wallet and I'd pay much more for the experience in Queensland being photographed with parrots. So, value for money it was ok and worth it just to have photos with the gorgeous parrots.The grounds are spectacular and the buildings amazing. The first thing you notice is the grand entrance that looks like some kind of twining serpent...except it's the artists signature in a stylised format. I didn't realise that the Blanco Museum was a monument to one person, I thought it was a collection of works by a person or the a 'white' building.So, we go through the doors and I'm gobsmacked at the overindulgent opulence of the place. And that's just the building...the artworks themselves are like being force fed fairy floss and then spun around at 100mph...it's dizzying seeing all of this over the top, mad-hatterish style framing and self aggrandising adornments on most of the work.I'm no fine artist, but I do know art, and Antonio's work is lovely and skilful, showing a unique style he made all his, yet to me, his fixation on the erotic and the over-endowment of his women, made the visit less than it could have been. Here was a talented man who found himself on a tropical island where all his european fantasies, fed from national geographics and Margaret Meade, came to life in the innocent balinese women.As I made my way through this 'mausoleum' of sex I noticed many of his works seemed to have the genitalia erased and darkened...wasn't sure about why, given the erotic nature of most of his works on display.Don't be mistaken, this is a man who was very talented and forsook the standard art school teachings to develop his own style, and his lifestyle may not have been to everyones taste, but he wasn't a fool when it came to monetising and cashing in on the people he met, mentors and his ability to work a canvas.As I went through the exhibition it was apparent to me that a number of pieces were mere reproductions - reproductions printed on canvas. I can buy this material and print my own reproductions, and I've seen this before, so I was deeply disappointed by this.Another thing that bothered me was the exiting of the building. I would have loved the opportunity to purchase some of the works in printed reproductions, but there was nothing available like this. Most 'museums' have this, so it was a lack I felt keenly...something light to take home as a memory in my luggage or to send to friends would have been very good. We were directed to the studio and then we went through some other buildings...and then we exited into the carpark and had to re-enter the facility again in order to get to the restaurant.Would I go again or take anyone there? No.Would a serious artist be interested? I don't think so.Would I recommend this to a visitor? No, I don't think so.Was it expensive? NoDid I get something for my money? Yes - pictures with gorgeous parrots.There is a very steep climb with no stairs to get to the museum, and it's not pram or disabled friendly in any way.The restaurant has a lovely menu, and considering the range of prices in Ubud, is mid range. $9 approx for a main meal. It's not pretentious, and has great bathroom facilities. They give you a lovely caramel coffee iced drink after your visit which is delightfully refreshing. I'd go back to the restaurant for a meal, but they are desperate for customers and will push you for a booking/reservation.

Stunning. I love the story of the founding family. The museum building and grounds are a trip in themselves. The art is an added bonus. They have recently opened a restaurant but I have not yet been there.

Interesting to take a view. Antonio Blanco was an excentric Spanish artist who established his residence in Bali by the 1950s, and stayed there all his life painting (mainly nude native girls). This museum was his house in Ubud (cultural center of Bali) and all the pictures in exposition are his work.It is interesting to take a view - maybe no the greatest place, but a good vision of the "paradise" that Bali was 50 or more years ago, through the eyes of the artitst.
Great museum ...... I love this museum.... Precious art and great place .... I feel i wanna stay there and enjoy the art and silent .... Really recomended for art lover ..
Bizarre place but cool. Quite a bizarre museum - terribly indulgent of course. But most definitely worth a visit if only to gawk

The Antonio Blanco Museum in Ubud, a real tropical oase with beautiful art in the centre of Ubud.. When I entered the Antonio Blanco Museum for the first time I was suprised by the beautiful interior of the building. I spend more time than I was entending to do because I was impressed by the paintings of this extravagant painter. This museum is a "must" when you are in Ubud. You won't be dissapointed !

For an experience of a Renaissance era @Bali. The Museum is loaded with beautiful paintings, not as many as expected and as comfy as felt for a 'commoner' like me to enjoy. But I truly opted the colourful of the 'painted doors' and the homey-feel of the garden in the front with some animals playing freely around.

Not to everybody's taste. It's worth stepping inside, just to see how extravagant it all is. The grounds are huge, as are the buildings, and it's all quite random, starting with the (very friendly) parrots just outside the main building and ending with odd things the museum has preserved from the artist's life.The art collection displayed is large enough, and that will give you a good overview of Blanco's works (although I've heard dark rumours that many are fakes, simple prints touched up with paint, practice pieces done by his students and signed after his death etc). They also display pieces from Antonio's son, Mario.Most of it isn't really to my liking, and the lighting was a bit poor in places, but a few pieces were very striking. Whether you like it or not, it's worth going in for a wander, but at Rps 50,000 it doesn't come cheap.

Blanco Museum and the Bali Starling DO NOT MIX.. Blanco Museum Ubud BaliWe visited the museum in October and whilst the artwork was interesting and thought provoking it was overshadowed by the plight of the caged Bali Starlings in the Museum’s extensive grounds.There were about 8 to 10 of these beautiful birds all housed together in a small cage , there were feathers missing from the throat area of all inhabitants and we witnessed the cause as them pecking each other. (which is apparently a sign of stress)Since this breed is critically endangered it was somewhat upsetting to see these birds not being cared for adequately. Two emails have been sent to the Blanco Museum via their own website over the past 4 weeks to gently bring this issue to the powers that be, but we have had no response. Please I strongly urge you to not visit this museum. Julie and Steven Smith Melbourne Victoria

magnificent gallery. This is a piece of paradise off the main road. The gardens and exotic birds are lovely.We were pleasantly surprised to receive a cooling welcome drink as we wandered through the gardens. And then comes the artwork- which is great. i particularly loved the framing for the artworks! Certainly worth the entrance fee.

Loved the paintings.. I was literally walking past here one day on the way to Bintang supermarket and decided to have a look. I was so glad I did. From not even having heard of this man, I got to learn something new and appreciate the beautiful paintings. Blanco obviously has an affinity for the female nude form and they were very good, although some a little kinky. The still life paintings are very good also.

lovely. worth a look, felt like it was a glimpse into a forgotten time in Bali.... not for families though with young children. Blanco's famous for topless paintings so if you wish to shield your children, I'd suggest visiting the gallery on your own.

Beautiful-but more information desired. This museum is beautiful. It's tucked a bit away from the downtown area, and it's a unique home and museum. We were greeted with a welcome drink and left on our own to explore the museum. Since I didn't know much about the artist I would have liked more information or exhibits with a bit more to read about the artist and his life. The grounds are well maintained and there are exotic birds at the entrance, but I enjoyed the art so much I wanted to know more!

Fun museum. A museum dedicated to the art of one man Antonio Blanco - idiosyncratic paintngs, but skilfully done. Very nice grounds and exotic birds. Just across the bridge from Murni's Warung, which is a good place to go to afterwards.

Probably the best Art Gallery that I've been to. I walked up to the Blanco Museum from my hotel and was really hot and sweaty by the time I'd climbed up the steep hill in the Bali humid heat. I paid my entrance fee of 50000 rupiah (About £3) and then was directed to the restaurant for my complimentary welcome drink which was ice cool and much appreciated. What I appreciated a whole lot more was the lovely cool towel that the waiter gave me.I walked around the Blanco museum and he's clearly very odd, very close/friendly to Michael Jackson and obsessed with erotica, but I really enjoyed his art. The building in which the gallery was based was beautiful Lots of very dark colours and gold, it should have looked horrendously tacky, but it was actually really intriguing and appealing. His artwork was a lot of very detailed oil paintings, but also lots of collage work interspersed with writings and poetry that he had written. I wasn't sure when I went up to the second floor of the gallery whether I should go up onto the roof using the slightly rickety spiral staircase, but I did anyway and the view was fantastic - jungle and rice fields. The gardens in which the museum and gallery is set are pretty spectacular too, there are loads of vividly coloured parrots on perches which if you like you can have put on your shoulder. I didn't really fancy this, but I did take a couple of pictures. I then ventured into the gift shop via a place where they had a DVD playing depicting a dodgy acting out of Blanco courting his Balinese dancer wife and bought the "Fabulous Blanco" book getting a bit confused by the conversion price again. (I paid 1 million rupiah about £60 and had buyers remorse, but then from my research online it is selling in some places for £500 or isn't available at all, so I felt a little happier!) This was such an unusual art gallery and I really enjoyed his work and I would definitely recommend it as excellent value for money.

a must see. Such fantastic art work by a very interesting artist. The museum has beautiful gardens with exquisit birds. A complimentary iced drink was much appreciated on the hot day. A lovely surprise at the art work as we did not know anything about Don Bianco but now love his work and wich we could purchase one or two :) Dont forget to go upstairs on the roof top for a terrific view of the area.

Blanco - A world apart. This oasis in Ubud was a great surprise.So vastly different to the gentle earthy town.Over the top building, rich luxurious colours in the museum itself and although he is said to be the Dali of Bali (I think it was the beret) I couldnt see any such references in his painting style. He has fun with his work,is sometimes topical and often humourous.He clearly enjoyed the bodies of women and didnt believe in the fiddliness of clothes so if you are after landscapes or not enamoured with the naked female body this is not the place for you.The entrance to the building is magnificent and the view from the roof stunning.The grounds themselves are beautiful and tranquil and beautiful orchids abound.Very close to the town of Ubud and an attraction not to be missed.

Blanco Museum. Magnificent building set in lush tropical grounds. Gorgeous colourful, tropical birds which the keeper put on my arms (3 of them). The interior of the building is just beautiful as is the artwork, some a little naughty! He certainly liked his nudes! At the end of the tour you are shown through his working area by a delightful Balinese girl, complete with giggles as she explains some of his artwork. Even if you are not into art, I would recommend you visit this museum anyway.

the Dali of Bali. I knew nothing about this man until we stumbled upon the entrance and came out uplifted and humoured. A self styled Dali of Spanish descent, this artist married a Balinese dancer and made Ubud his home. He has entertained the likes of Michael Jackson and Mick Jagger and painted collages in honour of them.
